Question: Write about the following topic.Many governments think that economic progress is their most important goal. Some people,however, think that other types of progress are equally important for a country.Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
The economic progress is an increase in the capability of a society to produce higher valued ( more and better ) goods and services with the use of the same or equivalent resources.
The benefits of economic growth include higher average incomes. Economic growth enables consumer to consume more goods and services and enjoy better standards of living.
The economic progress is an important goal for governments, because firstly, a healthy economy results in job creations, a high level of employment, and better salaries for all citizens. Secondly, economic progress ensures that more money is available for governments to spend on infrastructure and public services.
Another progress is important for a country, in my point of view, technical progress or technology in general is very important for a country, in many bases.
The technological progress refers to the discovery of new and improved methods of producing goods.
The term process technology refers to chemical processing used to refine raw materials into finished products. For example, process technology is used to refine crude oil.
Technological prosperity also lies in global purposes, so for military purposes and war technique, are important in terms of preparation and possessing advanced weapons.
And also for local and domestic or personal purposes, for example use of modern devices, and networks of the fifth generation ( 5G ).
There are many other types of important progresses, as industrial progress, architectural progress, commercial progress and civilization progress.
It all complements each other at the end. And all of them are of particular importance.
AI Essay: Many governments focus primarily on economic progress, believing it is the foundation for a stable and prosperous society. Economic growth often leads to higher employment, increased income levels, and the ability to invest in essential services like healthcare and education. For example, when a country’s economy grows, tax revenues usually rise, providing funds to improve infrastructure and support public welfare programs. However, some people argue that measuring progress solely by economic indicators overlooks other important areas, such as social development, environmental health, and advances in education or technology. If economic progress is achieved at the expense of environmental destruction, for instance, it can create long-term problems that reverse any short-term gains. Likewise, growth that increases wealth inequality can weaken social cohesion and limit opportunities for many citizens. In my opinion, while economic progress is vital, it should not be the only focus of a country’s development. A balanced approach that includes investment in social systems, environmental sustainability, and technological innovation is necessary to create a truly advanced and healthy society.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think living in big cities is bad for people’s health.To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

There are also a health concerns coming from having less exercise. However, usually, ther are many gyms in the city. Also, many cities tend to have a big park or walking track, wher people can go for walks and jogs.
However, I agree that people living outside the cities, especialy wher surrounded by natures will have more cleaner air. Also having more space to exercise, compare to people living in cities may assist in being able to maintain their health.
Some people thinks that it is not good for people's health to live in big cities. However, environmental facts varies depending on each cities. I believe thath people can still live healthy as much as people living in a suburban areas, if the trafic is significantly heavy compare to other area of the coutries, of have an opportunities to exercise regularly.
AI Essay: Many people believe that living in large cities has a negative impact on one’s health, and I think there are some strong reasons for this, though it is not always the case. One main concern is the poor air quality that is common in most big cities, as traffic congestion and high numbers of vehicles lead to more air pollution, which can cause respiratory problems over time. For instance, I have a cousin who developed asthma after moving to a busy city where the air was often filled with smog. Additionally, noise pollution from crowded streets and ongoing construction can lead to stress and trouble sleeping, both of which affect overall health. On the other hand, big cities often offer greater access to hospitals, clinics, and fitness centers, making it easier for people to take care of their health if they choose to. In my experience, living in a city has allowed me to join a gym that I visit regularly, which helps me stay active. In conclusion, while living in big cities can lead to certain health issues due to pollution and stress, there are also benefits like better healthcare and facilities for exercise, so I believe the effect on health depends largely on individual choices and the specific city environment.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think living in big cities is bad for people’s health.To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
In the past decades, the rise of urbanization has brought trends of moving into the cities. While some people believe that the availability of resources and welfare in metropolises can outweigh the unhealthy environment, I strongly believe that the fancy infrastructures come in exchange for health sacrifice.
To begin with, most megacities are overpopulated. With scarce resources and higher demands in every aspect, products and services received in these bustling locations usually come at a higher price, lower quality and longer waiting time. For example, it could take up to weeks or months to queue up for non-urgent medical services while it takes only a few days or even without booking in non-busy areas. Moreover, the nature of crowded areas accelerates the spreading of transmittable diseases during the pandemic.
Another undeniable health factor for those residing in cities is pollution. Most cities come with traffic issues where there are exceeding amounts of cars which create air pollution. It is proved that, in long term, smog in the air could result in respiratory diseases such as lung cancer. Furthermore, the number of the city's population is equal to the extremely large amount of waste and without an appropriate waste management system, it could lead to several more problems. One of them is pests such as mice and bugs which are the perfect mediums for severe diseases such as rabies.
All in all, urbanization has tremendous benefits to human society as a whole and is unavoidable in the present context. Thus, governments should focus on addressing these issues to ensure the sustainable progress of cities and the citizens' quality of life.
AI Essay: It is often argued that living in large urban areas may have negative impacts on people’s health, and to a large extent, I agree with this viewpoint. One major reason is the significant air and noise pollution associated with city life. For example, in many major cities such as Bangkok or Beijing, smog from millions of vehicles and factories hangs over the streets, increasing the risk of respiratory problems for residents. Additionally, the fast-paced lifestyle and constant rush can lead to higher stress levels, which may contribute to anxiety and sleep disorders. Limited access to nature and green spaces is another factor; many city dwellers rarely enjoy outdoor activities, which can decrease both physical and mental well-being. While cities may offer advanced medical facilities, the sheer number of residents often means long wait times and overburdened healthcare systems. Nevertheless, it is true that urban centers can provide better employment and education opportunities, but I believe these benefits sometimes come at the expense of public health. In conclusion, I agree that while big cities offer numerous advantages, the risks they pose to people’s health are considerable and should not be overlooked.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think living in big cities is bad for people’s health.To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
It is believed that cities provide a better life in the comparsion of the life in a small town or a village. However, some people consider that the life in big cities is generally hazardous for the health of people. In my opinion, although big cities provide many amenities to the people but the city life is not good for a person when it comes to health.
The main reason is continuous increase in population. Metropolitan cities attract people from small towns and/or villages in search of better opportunities, good education for their children or medical facilities. This migration makes these cities overcrowded. As population increases, there will be many vehicles on roads. More traffic will lead to more air and noise pollution. Likewise, as the population increases, the demand for housing also will escalate. To fulfill the demand of housing, local government has to reduce the green space to built more buildings in the city which will lead to more pollution. Obviously, pollution causes many health issues.
Another reason is stressful and busy life in the big cities. People working in big MNC companies in the cities, have deadlines to complete their work. If they are not able to meet the deadlines, it will affect their growth in the company. People in metropolitan cities are so busy that they don't have time to take care of their health. Living in a continuous stress without taking care of the health leads to many health problems.
To conclude, the life in a big city is very stressful, busy and surrounded with a lot of pollution, which is not good for health of an individual.
AI Essay: Some people argue that living in major cities is detrimental to people’s health, and I largely agree with this opinion due to several compelling reasons. One of the main issues is pollution from vehicles and factories, which is often much higher in urban areas than in the countryside. Breathing polluted air can cause serious respiratory problems and even increase the risk of heart disease. In addition, noise pollution from traffic and construction can disrupt sleep and elevate stress levels, making it difficult for city dwellers to maintain good mental and physical health. Another concern is the fast-paced and hectic lifestyle common in big cities. Most people work long hours and spend a lot of time commuting, leaving little time for exercise or preparing healthy meals. For example, some of my relatives who moved to a large city for better job opportunities now complain they barely have time for family or relaxation, which has led to high blood pressure and constant fatigue. Although big cities offer advanced medical care and entertainment options, the harmful effects of pollution, stress, and limited access to nature outweigh these benefits in my opinion. Therefore, I believe that living in big cities generally poses more risks to health compared to life in smaller towns or villages.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think living in big cities is bad for people’s health.To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Never has the topic concerning citizens’ health failed to attract people’s attention. However, when it comes to whether living in a metropolis would do bad to people’s health, individuals hold different views. As far as I am concerned, it does diminish individuals’ health conditions.
Undoubtedly, living in a metropolis has some benefits for the inhabitants’ health. A big city is more likely to provide individuals with high level medical services which can be helpful when people are afflicted with various diseases. Precisely, there are numerous community clinics as well as large hospitals where individuals can get access to offering people the most advanced medical technology and medicines. Thus, greater recovering possibilities are provided by big cities for sick people.
However, urban life can also be unhealthy due to numerous reasons. Firstly, individuals tend to suffer from greater mental stress in a metropolis. Specifically, the increasingly higher housing price contributes to the heavy financial burdens of individuals. People are compelled to struggle with high-intensity works due to the high cost in housing, which would cause a high mental pressure. Besides, one of the reasons for individuals’ mental pressure can be the indifferent relationship among urban inhabitants which is caused by the lack of a sense of community.
Furthermore, the poor air condition which is caused by the remorseless rush of pollution in big cities does do harm to citizens’ health conditions. For instance, the waste gas that discharged by the cars in the streets and the factories is polluting the air in urban areas, leading to a higher rate in diseases. As a result, citizens’ health conditions can be diminished physically.
In conclusion, although a metropolis can provide advanced medical services to urban inhabitants, living in big cities can also be hazardous to individuals’ mental heath and body health due to numerous factors. In my opinion, living in a metropolis is more likely to undermine people’s health.
AI Essay: The issue of whether residing in large urban areas is detrimental to people’s health has always sparked heated discussions. From my perspective, the negative impacts tend to outweigh the advantages. It is undeniable that big cities typically feature superior healthcare facilities, with a large number of modern hospitals and medical professionals, which means that residents can seek timely and efficient treatment for a range of illnesses. Such access to advanced care does improve health outcomes to some extent. Nevertheless, city life brings with it a host of health hazards. For one thing, air pollution in metropolises is notoriously severe due to the high density of automobiles and industrial activity. I have personally experienced frequent coughing and discomfort during days when the air quality index is particularly poor, and many urban dwellers suffer similarly from respiratory issues. Moreover, the fast-paced lifestyle often leads to chronic stress, as people face fierce competition for jobs and endure long commutes. This constant pressure can result in anxiety and even depression, which are increasingly prevalent in urban settings. Lastly, limited green spaces and crowded living conditions might discourage physical exercise and foster unhealthy eating habits, thus contributing to obesity and related illnesses. In conclusion, despite some health-related conveniences of metropolitan living, the overall threats to both mental and physical well-being make big city life more harmful to health in the long run.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think living in big cities is bad for people’s health.To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
There has been a lively discussion revolving around the megapolice influence on human health, as some people presume living in large cities results in a variety of problems. In my humble opinion, I consider big-city life to be harmful.
A row of arguments can prove this point of view. The air and water pollution in cities tend to provoke a spectrum of lung and skin diseases. A number of people encountering lung cancer, chronic bronchitis, eczema and psoriasis prevails in megapolicies compared to small towns and villages. Even I have acquired chronic bronchitis while leaving in Moscow. It also must be mentioned that constant contamination of enviroment has long-term consequence for human genetics. For instance, several decades ago the phenomena of allergy was not so widespread. And nowadays, several hundred thousands of people are suffering from it, as their immune system responds inadequately to ordinary things, such as animal fur or dust.
On the contrary, the medicine level in small villages cannot be compared with medicine in large cities. Some urgent problems such as limb break, infection, serious inflammation, heart attack, seizures or appendicits can be tackled only in large cities, where you can call an ambulance and it will come in a blink of an eye, while in countyside it can cause a dramatical outcome. My friend's grandpa in a distant village broke a rib and it stabbed his lung, and, unfortunately, ambulance did not make it in time.
To sum up, living in megapolice can possibly extend your life, but for me the quality of this life is still doubtful.
AI Essay: The question of whether residing in large cities negatively affects health is a topic that many people debate. Personally, I believe that urban living can indeed be detrimental to well-being for several important reasons. First of all, the chronic air and noise pollution found in big cities exposes residents to harmful substances and high stress levels, contributing to respiratory issues such as asthma and anxiety-related disorders like insomnia. For instance, when I visited a relative in Beijing, I noticed myself coughing much more often, despite only being there for two weeks. Furthermore, the fast pace of city life often leads to poor eating habits and lack of physical activity, since people rely on convenience foods and have limited access to green spaces for exercise. Still, there are advantages to city life, such as quick access to state-of-the-art hospitals and highly qualified doctors, which can sometimes mitigate the health risks associated with urban environments. Nevertheless, in my opinion, the overall lifestyle and environmental drawbacks outweigh the medical benefits. In conclusion, while living in a large city does offer better healthcare facilities, the day-to-day exposure to pollutants and the stress of modern urban life make it less than ideal for maintaining good health.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think living in big cities is bad for people’s health.To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
To what extent can living in a large city be unhealthy?
Living in a large metropolitan can bring many challenges to one's health. When you live and work in a never-ending rat race there can be consequences to your health becasue of the continuous stress brought on by increased workload, longer working hours and very little time to rest.
There is also an increase in pollution due to the high density of people, cars and other carbon immisions.
I agree to an extent that living in a big city can bring about its challenges to your health, however, there are many more advantages to living in a major city when ones health takes a dip rather than being ill in a rural or outlying area. Getting sick and having health issues is not bound by an area you live in. These things happen to us no matter where we live. Living stress free in a rural area does not take away the fact that I may carry a cancer gene.
In my experience living in both an outlaying area and a city, when I needed to see a specialist for a health condition, I had to travel many hours to a doctor in the metropolitain area. These types of highly qualified doctors do not practise in rural areas or areas that are outside of a bit city. Generally speaking a specialist will be in a metro area where there is access to state of the art hospitals.
Do I believe that living in a city can bring on certain illnesses? Yes, defrinatly.
I would much rather live in a big city where all my health needs can be easily accessed rather than in an area out of the city where I may not get the medical attention I need.
AI Essay: There are certainly concerns about the impact of living in big cities on people's health, especially when taking into account the high levels of air pollution, noise, and the fast-paced lifestyle. City life often exposes residents to smog and crowded streets, which can lead to respiratory problems and increased stress. On top of that, many people who work long hours in the city might not have time for regular exercise or cooking healthy meals, choosing convenience foods instead. Despite these health risks, I do not fully agree that city living is completely bad for people's health. The reason is that metropolitan areas also offer some significant health benefits. For example, people in big cities have access to advanced hospitals, specialists, and healthcare facilities, which can often mean earlier diagnosis and better treatment for illnesses. The city also often provides a variety of health-related services like gyms, parks, and mental health support, which can encourage a healthy lifestyle if people make the effort to use them. From my own experience, while living in a rural area gave me access to cleaner air, it was difficult to find a doctor quickly when I needed one. In the end, I believe that although there are drawbacks related to health in big cities, the advantages in terms of healthcare access and opportunities for a healthy lifestyle mean that city living is not necessarily bad for people’s health, provided individuals are proactive about managing the risks.

Question: Write about the following topic.Although there are a lot of translation software available, learning a language could still be advantageous. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Despite to the presence of vast amount of translation programs on computers and other electronic devices, it is still considered more beneficial in terms of learning language itself. In this essay, I will be describing my total agreement with this dilemma.
The utmost reason for learning new language instead of using various programs is that human brain makes necessary changes in its structure and produces necessary chemical substances which in turn gives other functions to the brain. As a result of this human brain gains new functions in addition to the language skills.
Another benefit coming from directly learning language is the opportunity to express your beliefs and emotions in that language which is impossible to realize via software programs. People around the speaker tend to understand the spoken language more easily and get the speaker's ultimate goal in a more usual and humane way.
The third reason for studying the language rather than carrying a software to translate might be the possibility of immediately using language. In other words, software programs can not find the right words according to the situations or conversations among people. As a consequence of this, due to different meanings which translation devices remain useless in such cases, huge misunderstandings can occur.
In a conclusion, in addition to the reasons mentioned above, using language by learning it always seems realiable and more realistic way than using device for this purpose. As I raised my pure opinion toward gaining language skill earlier I strongly believe that this method has been the most preferable method for decades and it will be.
AI Essay: While translation software has become increasingly advanced and widespread, I firmly believe that learning a language remains highly beneficial. One important reason for this is that direct knowledge of a language deepens cultural understanding and allows individuals to participate more fully in the customs and traditions of native speakers. For example, software may give the literal translation of an idiom or joke, but often misses the intended meaning or humor, making genuine communication difficult. Furthermore, people who know the language can react instantly in conversations and build personal connections, which is especially necessary in situations needing empathy, like making new friends or handling emergencies. Another reason is that the process of learning a language helps improve memory and cognitive skills, providing lifelong advantages beyond just speaking to others. Additionally, translation software is not always available or accurate, particularly for less common languages or in places without internet access, so personal language skills are reliable in more situations. Therefore, despite the help translation tools provide, I totally agree that the personal, social, and mental benefits of mastering a language make it far more advantageous.

Question: Write about the following topic.Although there are a lot of translation software available, learning a language could still be advantageous. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Some people claim that language knowledge has still benefited inspite of appearance of applications and websites providing translation in real time. Modern special software is able to give quite quality translation into different languages, and it seems that it will soon replace the translators and will get rid of necessity to learn new languages. However, in my opinion, there are still some essential advantages to know foreign languages.
First of all, any language is so complicated and constantly changing system that it is impossible to automized translation process to keep all senses. For instance, if you interlocutor creates a joke based on words game, it will unlikely recognise by AI. Thus, it is too hard to teach a computer to uderstand all meanings that you want to provide.
Another important aspect of learning languages is knowing new cultures. Language is the great source for understanding other nations and countries. If you use online translator, you will never know the origine of some idioms or phrases that contain culture code.
Moreover, learning new language is a tool of training your brain. It helps to develop memory and imagination. For instance, people didn't refuse studying maths after calculation device had been invented, because it is still important to understand how it works and it is necessary for developing other sciences.
Finally, there is a lot of places and occasions when you do not have internet access. Then online translators are not available. But if you need help or ask a path being abroad, it is better to know at least some phrases. Otherwise, you can occur in unpleasant situation.
To sum up, I definitely agree the statement that learning languages is essential in spite of techology progress. Although artificial intelligence is able to translate everything you want, it is crucial to continue learning languages in order to understand all sense and meanings in conversation with foreigners, to know new cultures and understand their peculiarities and, of course, to make your brain work.
AI Essay: In modern times, there are many applications and software that make translation between languages fast and convenient. However, I strongly believe that learning a language still holds significant advantages compared to relying only on translation technologies. Firstly, language is more than a tool for communication; it carries feelings, ideas, and cultural backgrounds. Translation programs often fail to translate the emotional meaning or humour correctly, especially when unique sayings or slang are used. For example, if someone uses a proverb or a phrase common in their country, the translation might not make sense, and the listener can misunderstand the whole point. Furthermore, when a person learns a new language, they also discover traditions, values, and ways of thinking different from their own, which strengthens their understanding of global cultures and encourages open-mindedness. Additionally, learning a language improves our memory and thinking abilities, as it exercises the brain in unique ways, just like solving puzzles or playing strategy games. Also, translation software is dependent on technology, so in situations with no internet or in places where devices are unavailable, knowing the local language is much more useful. In conclusion, while translation software is a helpful tool, I believe that language learning is essential for deeper communication, cultural appreciation, and personal development.

Question: Write about the following topic.Although there are a lot of translation software available, learning a language could still be advantageous. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

AI Essay: In my opinion, even though translation software has become advanced and widespread, learning a language still provides essential advantages. I have relied on translation applications when chatting with international friends or watching foreign movies, but I soon noticed some misunderstandings and awkward moments, like strange word order or confusing phrases, that the software could not resolve. Only by studying English myself, I started to better grasp the real meaning and cultural background behind the words, which software often skips. Furthermore, direct communication by knowing another language feels more natural and confident than using a machine as an intermediary. I also think that learning a language trains our brain, helps us make friends, and can give us better job opportunities, while translation software is only a temporary help. Overall, although translation software serves a helpful purpose, it cannot replace the deeper benefits and satisfaction gained from truly mastering another language.

Question: Write about the following topic.Although there are a lot of translation software available, learning a language could still be advantageous. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Despite several translation programmes exist on different platforms, studying and acquiring the essential rules of a language has more benefits. Owing to limited usefulness of translation softwares in daily life, to large extent, ı agree with this statement. However, educationalists may use these programmes as supporting management systems for academical purposes.
A growing number of softwares are available on online platforms to help people for translating documents or improve their language skills. Individuals from different sociocultural or educational levels frequently utilise these open-access and easily understandable operating systems. Moreover, some teachers recommend their use to promote the learning process of primary school pupils. Last but not least, because translating a sheet by using these programmes is less time-consuming and free of charge, its use is gaining popularity among young individuals with regard to academic communication and correspondence.
On the other hand, the utility of these file management systems are questioned by some experts in the field of philology. Additionally, while these operating tools have benefits in terms of easening the written communication, it has no practical advantage or use in verbal interaction. In conclusion, although translation softwares have limited benefits such as costeffectivity and usability, it should be restricted as a complementary tool for people with a significant background and knowledge of a language, and the advantages of learning a language including practicality in face to face communication clearly outweighs.
AI Essay: While it is undeniable that translation applications have become increasingly sophisticated and widely accessible, I still believe that mastering a language offers significant advantages that technology cannot fully replicate. One main reason is that communication in real-life situations often requires more than simply translating words; it involves understanding context, cultural references, and subtle nuances that translation tools frequently miss. For example, when traveling or living abroad, being able to hold natural conversations with locals or respond appropriately to unexpected situations is something that automated software cannot always manage effectively. Furthermore, people who learn new languages tend to improve their cognitive abilities, such as memory and problem-solving skills, which translation software cannot provide. It is also worth noting that employers in many fields value genuine language skills, as they indicate adaptability and a willingness to embrace diverse cultures, rather than just relying on digital tools. Therefore, while translation software is useful as a supplementary resource, I strongly agree that learning a language remains far more beneficial in both personal and professional contexts.

Question: Write about the following topic.Although there are a lot of translation software available, learning a language could still be advantageous. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
In reality, translation softwares makes a lot of people's lives easier when communicating with others that don't speak the same language. However, in my opinion, learning a new language might be more advantageous than using this software.
First of all, the process of learning new languages involves the ability to correspond words in two different dialects, which also requires using a lot of parts of our brain. Therefore, this process improves certain areas of our neurologic system, specifically, the left hemisphere, responsible for communication and speech.
In fact, multiple studies have shown that people that speak different idioms have a lower risk of neurologic diseases such as Alzheimer's and Dementia since the left side of the brain is more developed than others that might only know one language.
Furthermore, these types of software are not always accurate. In spite of being correct the majority of the time, there are some situations where the translation is wrong because of different factors.
One of them is that there's no translation for certain words in other languages, for example, "Saudade" in Portuguese has no correspondence in English.
Besides that, when using Google Translate one has to pay attention to the translation given in certain languages. In reality, when translating from English to Portuguese, sometimes the programme doesn't consider the fact that in Portuguese adjectives come after the noun while in English they came before.
Lastly, someone that chooses to use this type of system to communicate with someone, instead of learning that language loses a bigger amount of time than others that already speak that dialect. That is because one has to first record what the person is saying then tell the software their answer and wait for it to be translated to the other. This results in a quite complicated setting that might be aggravated in situations where the translator doesn't understand one of the persons involved in the conversation.
To illustrate this, when talking to the AI "Siri" on the iPhone or "Alexa" on Google, a lot of the time they don't comprehend what we are saying, which results in people having to repeat themselves several times.
In conclusion, I believe that learning a new language is easier than using a translation software. In fact, this not only boosts our knowledge but also avoids difficult situations where what people are trying to say is wrongly translated.
AI Essay: It is clear that advancements in translation technology have made it easier for people to communicate across language barriers, but I strongly believe that learning a new language remains much more beneficial. Firstly, knowing a second language allows individuals to express themselves more naturally and deeply, picking up on cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions that translation software often overlooks. For example, when I traveled to Japan, I noticed that simple greetings could change meaning depending on the time of day and the relationship between speakers—differences that apps like Google Translate rarely handle correctly. Additionally, language learning has cognitive benefits, as it challenges the brain to think in new ways, improving memory and problem-solving skills, which no translation tool can offer. Moreover, most software can struggle with slang or context-specific language, sometimes leading to embarrassing mistakes or confusion, especially in professional environments. While translation tools are helpful for quick understanding, relying solely on them can create dependency and limit meaningful connections with others. Therefore, I agree that despite the convenience of translation software, acquiring a new language still provides substantial personal, cultural, and mental advantages that technology cannot fully replace.

Question: Write about the following topic.Although there are a lot of translation software available, learning a language could still be advantageous. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Question: Write about the following topic.Although there are a lot of translation software available, learning a language could still be advantageous. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Translation softwares are a convenience that we see popping up more and more around us these days. I have seen these being used in daily life around me even very recently. For example, I was recently at the airport to travel from the east coast to the west coast of the US. While there, a passenger in line before me at the luggage drop off had his phone out and was talking to the attendants using his phone. On paying closer attention I realized, he was using a translation software to understand what they said and to respond back to them. It took some effort on both sides, but in the end, it worked!
This is a real-life example of translation software making peoples' lives easier on a regular basis. Witnessing this got me thinking - what would have happened in the absence of this service being available literally on the tips of our fingers. In the absence of this easy access to technology as we have today however, it has come down to one thing - the human capacity to learn and communicate in more than one language.
Coming from a multicultural background where none of my neighbors spoke the same language as me, it was inevitable that I would be exposed to multiple languages since childhood. This is a reality for most metropolitan cities around the world. When I was three years old and could communicate to some degree in my mother tongue or native language, my father ensured I also learned another one of our National languages that was prevalent in the region. By the time I was six-seven years old, I could conveniently speak in two languages. Meanwhile, in school, I was being exposed to the English alphabet in addition to the two other languages which made it easy to learn and understand English too. I can categorically say that knowing all three languages made my life infinitely easier for me since we moved around a lot due to my father's work arrangements.
Later on, during my college days, I met my best friend of eighteen years and was exposed to her native language or mother tongue and since then have picked up a passing knowledge of the language as well. The movies and plays around us while young used multiple languages too and as a result I have a passing knowledge of six languages today. This knowledge not only makes communicating a breeze for me in most areas in my country, it keeps my brain active.
In conclusion, I believe while translation softwares definitely make life easier for us on different occasions, being bilingual, trilingual, or a polyglot serves to make life interesting and easy at the same time. Truly understanding and speaking a language brings to light so many nuanced facets of an entire culture surrounding the language which cannot be translated through a translation software. It has been proven that learning multiple languages helps keep the human brain adaptable and flexible - all marks of a young and active mind. From my personal experiences, I believe that the translation softwares serve as a quick solution to the language barrier for people in general, learning a language brings in a level of richness to ones experience of life as a whole. Translations softwares should therefore not be considered as a replacement for learning a language but as an aide to learning a new skill.

It was impressive to see the interaction go smoothly, reminding me of how far technology has come in bridging language gaps. However, witnessing this also made me reflect on the depth of understanding that only comes with actually learning a language. Growing up in an immigrant household, my parents emphasized the value of preserving our native language alongside English, encouraging me to speak both at home and in school. Beyond practicality, research shows that bilingual individuals often benefit from better cognitive flexibility and memory retention compared to monolingual speakers. All in all, while translation software provides an incredible convenience in breaking initial barriers and easing travel or business situations, I strongly believe that learning a language enriches one’s life in ways technology cannot replicate. It is not only about speaking with others; it is about understanding perspectives, appreciating traditions, and cultivating a mindset open to lifelong learning. Therefore, I think translation tools are best viewed as supportive companions on the journey, but the true rewards come from making the effort to learn a new language oneself.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think that we should divide students based on their academic ability, while others think we should educate all students together. Essay:
There are several systems of education, some of them more efficients than others. Students of today are the proffessionals of tomorrow and thus is very important they recibe a propper education. In my opinion we should divide students based on their academic ability.
If we educate all students together regarthless of their different academic abilities we will be making a hughe mistake. Students with higher capacities will not be adressed in a propper way and it will discourage them. Smart students tend to get bored very fast and therefore special attention must be pay to them.
On the contrary, if we educate students based on their academic abilities we will not only see better results in the smarter ones, but we will also take better care of the students with more learning difficulties. By using this method the needs of the students will be adressed in a better way.
Education should have an indiviudal focus or at least in different groups, taking academic abilities degrees in account.

These special students have different learning times and needed more atenttion from their teachers. On the other hand, some students were very smart with great academic abilities and some of them had some behaviour troubles becouse they got bored at class, I remmember one student named Jackson Bell who was brilliant and was sent to the school physicologist due to behaviour problems(he hit other students) and if teachers have gaived Jackson the extra attention he needed that wouldn´t happen.
AI Essay: There are many debates about the most effective way to organize students in schools, especially when it comes to their academic ability. Some people believe dividing students by this factor helps them learn more efficiently, since they can get instruction that matches their needs. Others think every student should be taught together, because mixing abilities teaches cooperation and prevents anyone from feeling left out. In my view, separating students by ability may give the best results for everyone. On one hand, teaching all students together can support those who struggle, as advanced students can help them, and everyone gets the same opportunities. However, this often causes problems: advanced students may not be challenged and become bored, while struggling students feel frustrated trying to keep up. From my own experience, I noticed that in mixed classes some talented students would not pay attention or would disturb others because the lessons were too easy, while some students always needed more time and support. When I attended after-school tutoring that split us into groups based on our skill level, everyone was more focused, and people improved faster. For these reasons, I believe grouping students according to their academic ability is a better approach, as it helps each student learn at a pace and level that suits them.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think that we should divide students based on their academic ability, while others think we should educate all students together. Discuss both views and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Nowadays, a topic often discussed is the education and its relation with the difference in people's ability and possibilities. According to some, it should be better to separate students based on their academic skills, while others believe that a valid education can be transmitted without discriminating people based on their ability.
People that support the separation of students believe that an omogeneous group can learn better and faster. Indeed, if someone has less skills compared to the others component of the group, teachers have two possibilities. First, to lower the level of the lessons in order to allow a catch up. Second, leave behind the student wiht low ability. Both solutions are not optimals. Thus, if we put together students with similar capabilities, we can make the process of learing more efficent for both groups.
The other vision is to educate students all together. By doing so, you can encourage low skills students to engage theirselves to catch up with the most brilliant one. Moreover, if you split the group, students with less capabilities can develop self-estimation problems and so, they will think that they can not be in the "best" group. Another good point for educate all students together is that people with higher ability will help their classmates. However, the level of the class will be probably lower.
To conclude, I think that the best solution depends on the purpose of the educator and on the age of students. Indeed, it is very differet the education of children or teenagers. For example, if you want to create the future class of engineers, you should divide students based on their academic ability. But if you want to educate people as humankind you should not divide the class.
AI Essay: Currently, there is a debate regarding whether students should be separated according to their academic ability or whether all students should be taught together in mixed-ability classes. Supporters of dividing students by level believe that this creates a more effective learning environment, where teachers can adapt their methods to the specific needs of each group. For example, advanced students can be challenged with more complex material, while those who need extra support can learn at a slower pace without feeling rushed. On the other hand, those who oppose this idea argue that mixed classes foster a sense of community and cooperation, allowing students to learn from one another. They point out that separating students may harm the confidence of those placed in lower groups and can increase feelings of inequality in the classroom. From my own experience, studying in mixed-ability classes helped me develop patience and empathy because everyone worked together, and stronger students often helped those struggling. In conclusion, while there are benefits to both systems, I personally think that mixed-ability classrooms are better because they promote social skills and a positive learning environment for all.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think that we should divide students based on their academic ability, while others think we should educate all students together. AI Essay: Some people think that dividing students by their academic ability is the best choice because it allows teachers to focus on the specific needs of each group. For example, students who learn quickly can be challenged more and pushed to reach their potential, while those who need extra help can receive more attention and not feel overwhelmed. This can lead to better results overall, as every student can learn at the pace that fits them best. However, there are drawbacks to this method, such as students feeling judged or being separated from friends, which might lower their confidence or make them feel left out. In my opinion, it is better to organize students based on their academic ability because it helps teachers give the right support to everyone, but it is also important to make sure that students still have chances to mix and learn with others so that no one feels isolated or discouraged.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some people think that we should divide students based on their academic ability, while others think we should educate all students together. Discuss both views and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Nowadays, people hold different ideas about how to distribute students at schools. Some individuals argue that minors should be taught separately based on their academic performance, whereas others state that they ought to be educated together. This essay will discuss both viewpoints, although it is my opinion that it is better to allocate students together regardless of their capabilities.
Proponents of the idea of dividing children at different levels argue that the selection can better facilitate an efficient and productive learning environment for different students. More specifically, by doing so, schools can provide specific objectives to meet students’ needs as young people have distinctiveness in learning preferences, personalities, and interests. Therefore, through selecting and separating the youth into a range of classes based on their talents and intelligence, schools cannot only tailor a result-oriented syllabus to explore each student’s maximum potential but also improve the quality of education since excellent students can learn in a fast way without anyone being left behind. In contrast, ordinary students can still keep up with the majority with complete comprehension. Furthermore, this can also minimise the possible pressure that some academically challenged students suffer from the negative psychological impacts, considering their poor performance in the exams or assignments.
Others, however, who point out that mixed classes attach great importance to the contribution of healthy competition and collaboration, also make valid arguments. Despite the possible imbalance in each student’s academic performance in a class, superior peers can serve as a desirable role models to others. Their strengths, such as learning attitudes and methods, can enlighten the rest of the class to improve and study. In addition, the diversity in class can promote mutual study among children with different abilities and create a better environment for children’s all-rounded development. Since the way of streaming students has been proven effective and practical, this mode of teaching is highly advisable by educational experts, and there are still many schools following this norm to educate children rather than set them apart as many students who are not excellent at study may experience disappointment and a lack of confidence when compared to those straight-A students in separated classrooms.
In conclusion, although the teaching resources can be assigned more precisely to target youngsters’ gifts in the streaming, it is still too early and unfair at this stage. Question: Write about the following topic.Some people believe that teaching children at home is best for a child's development while others think that it is important for children to go to school.Discuss the advantages of both methods and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
There are a lot of different opinions regarding the teaching of children and what is best for a childs developement. Although some people believe that homeschooling is the best teaching method for the developement of children, most people are of the opinion that it is essential for children to go to school.
The most popular of the two opinons is that it is important for children to attend school. The main reason that people believe this, is because socialization with other children in school is viewed as being essential for the cognitive and social developement of children. The advantages of children attending school therefore consists of an improved social life with more friends their own age. This can help young children figure out how to navigate social situations better and improve their own self-image by receiving confirmation from their peers. Although there are a lot of advantages for children attending school, there are also a lot of disadvantages. The main disadvantage is that children don't get to spend a lot of time with their family. This can decrease the influence that parents have on their children in the long term and inable their ability to raise their children according to their own values.
The other less popular opinion is that it is better to teach your children at home rather than to send them off to school. The main reason that some people believe this, is because these parents are concerned that outside influences have the ability to disturb their childrens upbringing. The greatest advantage of homeschooling is that it promotes a better nuclear family and provides parents with more control concerning their childs upbringing. However, this schooling method comes with some disadvantages too, since childrens social developement can be hindered due to inatequate social interactions with children their own age.
In conclusion, I believe that it is best for childrens developement to be taught at school, rather than parents teaching their children at home. I hold this opinion since school attendance can enhance childrens social skills and their ability to navigate the world around them.

Question: Write about the following topic.In some parts of the world people try to find out one's own family history. Why do people do this? Do you think it is a positive or negative?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

It took me a while to understand their feelings. I needed to put myself into their shoes. I believe there are many reasons for someone to dig into history to have a deeper knowledge of his own family. Firstly you may get a better understanding of the behaviours of your closest relatives. Also you can find the reasons behind the colour of your skin or your eyes.

Question: Write about the following topic.There are several factors that motivate people to stay in the workforce, and money is the most important reason/factor. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
The topic of motivation for work has merely failed to be discussed. Someone elaborate that the most significant factor is money while others suppose it is not. As far as I am concerned, although money is of great importance, it cannot always be the most valuable one.
Undoubtedly, money can be a crucial factor to diminish the financial burden of families, especially for those who were born in a poverty-stricken area. To be more specific, only by earning sufficient money can they raise their later generations and keep the elderly. Provided that they cannot find a decent job that allow them to own some disposable money, it would add insult to injury.
However, there are a great number of factors that may be considered as worthwhile to be the motivation of stay in the staff by some people. First of all, being in the workforce can help to strengthen an individual’s interpersonal skills. It is widely acknowledged that there are a colossal number of activities as well as team programmes that require people to collaborate, compromise and compete with the others. Thus, individuals will tend to learn some social skills and become gregarious and sociable, which can help them better adapt themselves to the mainstream society. In addition, people may also get a chance to broaden their horizons and lay a firm basis for future development by staying in the workforce. For instance, under the circumstance that numerous companies may provide the staff with the opportunity to go abroad and get involved in some international programs, people are able to get access to different cultures. As a result, people can develop panning-for-gold thinking rather than sponge-feeding thinking in the process of understanding divergent cultures, which can be beneficial for their future careers.
In conclusion, although money is valuable for individuals to be in the workforce, there are many other factors that cannot be overlooked. Only by treating all the factors rationally can we enjoy the pleasure rather than pressure.

Opportunities for learning new skills and advancing in one’s career can be equally motivating, as people often want their work to be meaningful and fulfilling. For example, some of my friends have chosen to stay at their jobs even when offered higher pay elsewhere, simply because they enjoy the culture and find the work interesting. To summarize, while I agree money is a very important factor behind why people stay in a job, factors like job satisfaction, opportunities for development, and a good working environment also play significant roles in keeping employees motivated.

Nevertheless, reporting the reality of crime is important for keeping the public informed and aware of dangers in their communities. People need accurate information to make safe decisions or participate in important discussions about safety and justice. Instead of total restriction, I think media should use warnings, avoid unnecessary graphic footage, and present crime stories carefully, so as to inform but not traumatize audiences. In conclusion, the responsible reporting of violent news is crucial, and it should be managed with sensitivity rather than being hidden completely from the public.

Question: Write about the following topic.The most important function of music is that it helps people reduce stress. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Music can induce extremely strong changes in people's mental states. There are several everyday examples that highlight the tranquillizing effect of music. Many people find out merely by instinct that they tend to calm down by listening to their favourite tunes. When someone feels anxious before an important exam, a medical visit, or a long-awaited date, music can provide a couple of minutes escape from these stressful situations, on our way to the event's venue. Soft music is also frequently utilized during meditative activities, such as yoga or relaxation. Additionally, people can come across the same type of calming tunes in dental or medical settings as well. However, these are quite passive coping techniques.
On the other hand, there are more active possible mechanisms by which music can reduce stress. When dancing or working out to upbeat music, people decrease their stress levels through movement. It can be an even more efficient way to let the harmful energies behind because of a two-way effect: music tends the soul, while the movement is good for the body, reducing tension in the muscles.
In summary, based on the above-reviewed examples of how music can be helpful in stress-relief, we can see that there is two possible mechanism, a passive and an active, which can play a role in this phenomenon.

While music also provides entertainment and brings people together socially, its power to ease stress is unmatched, making it a crucial tool for maintaining a healthier mindset in a hectic world.

Question: Write about the following topic.Many people use written language in a less formal and more relaxed way. Why? Does this development have advantages and disadvantages?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
People tend to use more informal words in their language to express and communicate with each other rather than following formal words.
There are several reasons for this, and I believe that it has some disadvantages and advantages. The key contributor to informal writing is technological innovation. For instance, WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, and Instagram allow people to send texts to each other anywhere and anytime just by connecting to the internet.
Furthermore, the texting culture of using abbreviated phrases has grown increasingly prevalent. As a result, applying casual language in written form has become more popular, and this substantially affects the written language.
I believe that this trend may carry a certain degree of risk. Firstly, when using written language in an easier going way many times, people can forget how to write a formal letter. In fact, the current generation gets used to texting, so the young are not aware of how to write a formal email to apply for a job. Instead, they write these emails like they are texting with friends.
Secondly, informal writing can adversely affect the academic performance of students. The students tend to utilize abbreviated words or slang in essays and assignments that require a greater level of formality.
One evident benefit to having more informal written communication in our professional lives is that it is less time-consuming. For instance, busy individuals working on the same task can share information instantly through a quick chat, rather than write a long and formal mail chain that requires thoughtful editing and proofreading.
In conclusion, although there are disadvantages to using informal words in written language, there are also attractive advantages. I believe individuals should use informal words when texting with family and friends but when it's an office or business-related work then they should use formal words in written language.
AI Essay: Nowadays, people often prefer using relaxed and casual language in their written communication, and this is largely due to the growth of digital technology and social media platforms. Applications such as Twitter, Snapchat, and instant messaging services encourage fast and easy exchanges, which makes people more likely to use abbreviations and slang instead of formal language. For example, many people write “u” instead of “you” in text messages to save time. This shift towards informal writing has its pros and cons. The main advantage is that it allows for quicker, more efficient communication, especially when people are in a hurry or need to connect with others informally. It helps build stronger personal connections and reduces the pressure to be perfect in every message. However, the downside is that it can make it harder for people, especially students, to master the formal writing skills needed in education or the workplace. I have noticed that some younger people struggle when asked to write official emails or reports because they are so accustomed to informal texting. In conclusion, while using informal written language offers convenience and can improve relationships, it is important to remember the value of formal writing in certain situations, such as academic or professional contexts.

Question: Write about the following topic.Many people use written language in a less formal and more relaxed way. Why? Does this development have advantages and disadvantages?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

This rapidness has been allowed by the spread of emails as the principal mean of written communication. Likewise, the reader itself, having much less time, is prone to take just a rapid look at the emails, not caring much if the way they are written is formal or not.

On the other hand, it is often hard to draw a limit. Some readers can think that the person sending the informal email is just being rude, leading to a misunderstanding. Question: Write about the following topic.Many people use written language in a less formal and more relaxed way. Why? Does this development have advantages and disadvantages?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Question: Write about the following topic.In many countries large amounts of foods are wasted. Why do you think people waste food in this way? What can be done to reduce the amount of food thrown away?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Food crisis might be considered as one of the most worrying matters among the globe. Despite the fact that poverty ratios are constantely increasing, tonnes of foods were thrown away every year. I believe that uncountable reasons could be behind this awful phenomenon, and many solutions should be taken to reduce the amounts of these wasted foods and to reduce the starvation. I will mention some in this essay.
Starting from the root causes, cooking a feast for a small group of people might be considered part of any country's culture such as many countries in the golf area, or otherwise, the person would look as stingy or even a bad host. Although some people order a huge amount of food just for the purpose of bragging, sometimes it could be due to wrong estimation of the number of guests or the portion that is needed for each individual.
Nevertheless, such matter should have immediate solutions, on both personal and global level. Governments should take all actions needed to increase the awareness of the danger of this problem and its negative consequences, whether through social media platforms or through the national TV, and to find innovative ways to hold their citizens responsible for minimising such cruical issue. Moreover, individuals should always make sure to donate the extra food to any person that is in need.
In conclusion, wasting food has been a significant issue since very long time ago. There are many reasons for this unpleasant habit, whether due to cultural impact or personal attitude; therefore, fast actions must be taken from both individuals and governments.
AI Essay: Food wastage is a serious concern in many countries today, despite the existence of hunger in various parts of the world. One of the main reasons people waste so much food is the convenience and abundance in modern societies, which often leads to people buying or preparing more food than they need. For example, many restaurants serve large portions, and people at home may buy in bulk because of discounts or promotions, only to throw away what spoils. Additionally, a lack of awareness about food storage and expiration dates can cause people to discard food unnecessarily. To address this problem, it is important for both governments and individuals to take action. Governments could launch public campaigns to educate citizens about food wastage and how to reduce it, such as by planning meals carefully and storing food correctly. Supermarkets and restaurants could also donate excess food to charities or food banks rather than throwing it away. On a personal level, people should try to buy only what they need and share leftovers whenever possible. If everyone makes a conscious effort, we can significantly reduce the amount of food wasted and help those who are in need.

The government and country's leaders should take the first step in conducting educational campaigns on food wastes and poverty, particularly targeting school children and the public. This can play a significant role in shedding light onto the issues that need to be addressed urgently. People should also be strongly encouraged to take a more sensible amount of food before coming back for seconds to avoid the unecessary wastage as well as the excess weight gain.
To sum up, food wastage is not something to be proud of because of the all the adverse effects brought upon us, humans. Hence, we should quickly make the much needed change to help to turn this situation around and hopefully contribute to creating a better society.
AI Essay: In today’s modern societies, it is a concerning reality that food wastage has become an everyday occurrence, even while millions of people still face hunger around the world. One main reason why so much food is discarded is because people often buy more than they actually need, especially when shopping at supermarkets where discounts tempt customers to purchase items in bulk. Additionally, social events such as parties and family gatherings frequently lead to over-preparation of meals, as hosts are often worried about not having enough for their guests. Another contributing factor is that some individuals lack awareness of the true value of food and the effort it takes to produce it, leading them to throw away edible items simply because they are slightly past their ‘best before’ dates or do not look perfect. To address this problem, governments and communities should invest in educational campaigns that teach people about the consequences of food waste, both environmentally and socially. Furthermore, supermarkets and restaurants can help by donating surplus food to charities instead of disposing of it. Lastly, individuals can make a difference by planning their meals more carefully and only buying what they need. By taking these steps, we can collectively reduce the amount of food thrown away and move toward a more responsible and compassionate society.

Question: Write about the following topic.In many countries large amounts of foods are wasted. Why do you think people waste food in this way? What can be done to reduce the amount of food thrown away?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Nowadays, many countries are confronted with the increasing amount of waste and one of the major contributions is food wasted by people. This issue is mainly driven by an over-ordered food and misunderstanding about the method of food disposal. However, people could cease from creating food waste through the act of both restaurants and governments.
To begin with, it is obvious that countries have wasted because the amount of food that people buy is more than the amount they need. The crucial factor of this behavior is that when people contemplate menus in a restaurant, they tend to order many items in order to satisfy their desire level. Eventually, a lot of food scraps are left when these people finish eating their meals. Another potential cause could be because people do not know how to deal with food scraps. As a result, they might understand that putting wasted food into a garbage is the only solution they could do. This is exemplified by statistics published by Thai waste association which demonstrate that more than a half of waste in Thailand come from household food.
A possible solution for this matter could be for restaurants to fine their customers who leave some food. This policy possibly encourages customers to carefully think of the reasonable amount of food when they order. In addition, from the country’s level governments could also educate their citizens including companies in the food-service industry about how to do with food waste due to the fact that some edible items could be food for animals. For instance, authorities could give an instruction demonstrating that dogs can be fed with remaining food such as rice or bread while remaining vegetables can be food for rabbits.
In conclusion, people waste food since they order food by what they want without considering the amount and most of them misunderstand about the way to dispose of food waste. Nevertheless, this concern can be coped with the penalty by restaurants as well as the guidance from governments regarding feeding animal with food scraps.
AI Essay: In many parts of the world, food wastage has become a notable problem, especially as people often buy or prepare more food than they are able to consume. One of the reasons why so much food is discarded is that individuals in wealthier societies tend to purchase goods in bulk, enticed by discounts or special offers, without considering their actual needs. As a result, uneaten food quickly reaches its expiration date and is thrown away. Another factor is that people sometimes lack awareness regarding food preservation methods, like properly storing leftovers, or they might be overly cautious about expiration dates, tossing products that are still safe to eat. To address this issue, both educational and policy measures can be effective. For example, governments could launch public campaigns to inform citizens about accurate interpretation of ‘best before’ labels and techniques for minimizing household waste. Additionally, supermarkets and restaurants could partner with charities to donate unsold but edible food to those in need, as has been done in several countries with promising results. By raising awareness and encouraging better food management practices, society can make significant progress in reducing the amount of food that ends up in landfills.

AI Essay: In recent times, the problem of wasting food has grown significantly in many parts of the world, and this is mostly due to both consumer habits and a lack of awareness about food management. A primary reason for this issue is that people often purchase or prepare larger quantities of food than necessary, whether shopping at supermarkets or dining out. Question: Write about the following topic.Some people believe women are better leaders than men. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Many people have a opinion that a women can be a good leader than a men. In my opinion, I totally agree with this statement and many reasons will be provide in this essay.
For the first reason, Leadership is a skill that up to a people, and it is not specific by sexes. In modern world, there are many company that let their department lead by both women and men, and to measure the result for comparing a difference that can be shown on profits that own by each section. For example, It is can be argue if the traditional company is let women firstly lead the project rather than previous, which done by a men. However if the result show profit, so it can be proof that even it is not a men the out come still worthy.
Moreover, Women emphathy in leadership is still significantly reason, we can see that people can be at ease for give more opinions by the mother nature when it come arguement or under pressure at workplace.
