Question: The movement of people from the countryside into the cities is happening in many parts of the world, resulting in the problems, especially in cities.What are the causes of this movement, and how can it be reversedGive reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Nowadays all over the world more and more families immigrate from rural to urban areas and such a situation leads to a number of undesirable consequences for city residents and regions in general. In this essay I shall try to cover some reasons for this trend as well as provide a number of solutions.
To start with, we have to consider the logic behind this movement. Firstly, as a rule, the countryside does not have enough educational institutions, so after finishing high school most students are obliged to move to other parts of the country in order to obtain higher education and, eventually, apply for well-paid jobs that are available only in bigger cities. Secondly, despite being provided with basic services, people still feel the lack of entertainment facilities, such as cinemas, theaters and others. In other words, most of the rural population is bored and have nothing else to do, that is why they are bound to immigrate to urban areas.
Luckily, there are a number of solutions, which could be implemented and, hopefully, they can solve or, at least, ease the situation. Initially, it is vitally important that the government allocates more funds to rural areas and use this money for construction of public amenities such as hospitals, schools, kindergartens, and others. If those facilities were introduced, then villagers would have fewer incentives to move. The second option that we have to consider is to promote living in the countryside by providing tax cuts, subsidies and other measures of economic stimulation, which could prove to be effective in the long run.
All things considered, it can be clearly seen that the lack of facilities and money are the two most important reasons as to why more villagers move to the cities. Unless the government provides a number of economic incentives along with public facilities, it might be difficult to overturn this trend.
AI Essay: Migration from rural areas to large cities is a widespread issue that introduces significant challenges, particularly for urban centers, and in this essay I will explore the main motivators for this movement as well as ways to address it. Primarily, one key reason for rural-to-urban migration is the scarcity of good job opportunities in the countryside; many small towns can only offer work in agriculture or local services, which may not be well-paid or consistent. Furthermore, cities often provide better access to healthcare and technical advancements, making urban living very attractive, especially for young families seeking improved standards of living. Another factor contributing to this trend is the overall lack of infrastructure in villages, notably poor transportation links and limited social outlets, which can lead to feelings of isolation. To reverse this movement, I think the government should invest more heavily in rural development by building modern schools, hospitals, and even supporting small businesses to create more jobs locally. Additionally, organizing community events and building sports or cultural centers could enhance social life in villages and make them more attractive places to stay. In conclusion, better employment prospects and superior urban infrastructure are the main reasons for population shifts from the countryside, but with government support and increased investment, life in rural areas could become much more appealing, thereby reducing the pace of urbanization.

Question: Many people today, especially in the developed world, are choosing to have fewer children, or none at all.Why is this happening, and do you think it is a good trend?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Weather to have children or not is one of the most important questions young adults have to ask themselfs nowadays. Overpopulation is one of the many global problems next to climate change, and poverty.
In my opinion, the need to have children roots back to us being nothing more, but civilised animals. Animals have one goal above all; reproduce. This is why in many cultures, men and women who cannot have chlidren are seen as disabled, or sick. Nowadays, modern values changed our perspective, having children is often seen as a necessity for a happy, and successful life.
It is important to recognise the problems the developed world faces. There is smoke in the air, plastic pollution everywhere, poverty in third world countries, and many other factors that make Earth a terrible place for many. Above all, the life we give birth to will have to eat, drink, and consume just like everyone else, using more and more of the already limited resources, generating more and more trash.
Many people argue that the above mentioned points are a pessimistic and unrealistic. Humans have to reproduce, to keep the species from extintion. And truthfully the only way to do that, is to give birth as many kids as possible. This issue lies deep in our society; here in Hungary, a family is rewared almost 30000 USD if they have 3 or more kids. This means that many people have children because they get money for it, and they are also seen socially accepted.
I believe modern day intelligence goes further than IQ points and money earned. We have to recognise the problems created, overpopulation being one of them. While I do not believe that we should not have kids, I think there should be careful planning involved and self-reflection before giving birth to new life.
AI Essay: In recent years, more people in wealthy countries are deciding to have fewer children, or even choosing not to become parents at all, and there are several factors behind this shift. One major reason is the rising cost of living; raising a child today involves significant expenses for healthcare, education, housing, and extracurricular activities, and many couples feel financially unprepared for such a burden. Furthermore, changing social values have placed greater emphasis on personal fulfillment and career development, with many individuals wanting to travel, pursue hobbies, and focus on their professional lives rather than taking on the long-term responsibilities of parenthood. Environmental concerns also play a role, as some people worry that bringing more children into the world will increase strain on the planet’s finite resources and exacerbate issues like climate change. For example, a close friend of mine recently decided against having children because she wanted to reduce her carbon footprint and dedicate her time to volunteering for wildlife conservation. Whether this trend is positive or negative depends on perspective; on one hand, fewer children can mean a less crowded planet and more resources per person, but on the other, it might lead to aging populations and labor shortages in the future. I believe that while everyone should have the freedom to choose what’s right for them, it is crucial for societies to thoughtfully balance personal desires with the long-term needs of their communities.

Question: Boxing is a blood sport which often results in physical injury. It is inappropriate for this sport to exist in the modern age.Do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Boxing is really dangerous sport which usually leads to physical injuries. However, I do not agree that it is inappropriate for the modern age to has such a sport, since it is a huge part of our culture and many people actually enjoy watching it.
To begin with, boxing is depicted as blood but fair and honorable sport in different kinds of art, such as literature and cinema. For instance, Ernest Hemingway has a number of stories related to this sport in his book "Men Without Women", and there are also various movies about boxing. A one may become boxer for different reasons: it could be encouraged by existing culture, it could be a wish to fight fairly without any lie which is rarely achievable in life outside sport, or a way to throw out internal aggression. In any way, it is his or her freedom of choise whether to take part in this sport or not, and I believe it is absolutely not appropriate to forbid people boxing.
Furthermore, people actually like watching boxing, otherwise it would not be so popular. They associate themselves with a sportsman and experience rush and adrenaline along with him. After a competetion, fans usually feel relief as after great movie, except they know that all the action took place in real life, which is not a case for movies. This perception of reality increases the feelings greatly, leading to more fascinating experience.
In the end, I want to underline this again: I believe that boxing is totally appropriete for the modern world, along with other extreme sports, and its cancellation would be absolutely unfair and generally bad, even though it is undisputably very injury-prone.
AI Essay: While it is true that boxing often leads to serious injuries, I do not agree that this sport is no longer appropriate for the modern world, because it has significant cultural value and provides opportunities for many people. To start with, boxing has a long history and is deeply woven into the fabric of society in many countries. Many famous figures, such as Muhammad Ali, have inspired millions with their achievements in the ring, and these stories continue to motivate people today. Additionally, boxing is not just about violence; it requires discipline, technique, and respect for one's opponent, which are important values. For many participants, boxing is also a way out of poverty, helping them build a better life through hard work and dedication. Of course, the risks are high, but safety rules and equipment have improved over the years, and athletes are aware of what they are signing up for. Just like other dangerous activities such as rock climbing or football, it comes down to personal choice. In conclusion, despite the dangers, I think boxing should continue to exist, as it brings value both to individuals and to culture as a whole, and banning it would take away important freedoms.

Question: Boxing is a blood sport which often results in physical injury. It is inappropriate for this sport to exist in the modern age.Do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Boxing is a dangerous kind of sport that may cause physical injury. Some people tend to believe that this sport should not exist nowadays. This controversial statement has both advantages and disadvantages, which will be discussed in this essay.
A tremendous number of people think that boxing is an excellent way to fit a body and improve coordination. For instance, if parents want their kids to know how to defend themselves, they let them attend boxing masterclasses. However, the main aim for parents is to find a skilled, experienced coach for their children. They may think if a teacher is an expert, their kids will not suffer during training. Notwithstanding, it does not always work like that.
On the other hand, a lot of people completely disagree that boxing as a business industry has a right to exist in the modern world. They are convinced that people who fight should not suffer because of the wishes of rich people who enjoy the show. For example, if a young person gets a physical injury during a fight, he will probably get money for that; however, it does not mean that he will get better after the final battle. Also, people who protest against this blood sport probably dislike advertisements related to boxing. They may think that even these videos impact people's behaviour and motivate them to commit violence against others.
In conclusion, boxing is a part of the blood business that should be forbidden in the modern age. From my point of view, if a person wants boxing nowadays, there are a lot of different ways to do it, like VR simulation, without harming other people.
AI Essay: Boxing has long been considered one of the most dangerous sports, and many people think it is no longer suitable for our modern society. Those who support boxing argue that it teaches discipline, builds fitness, and gives individuals a way to escape difficult life situations. For example, some young people find purpose and structure in their lives through training and competing, as the dedication required can steer them away from trouble. At the same time, however, it is easy to see why people oppose boxing, especially because of the risk of serious injuries such as brain trauma and broken bones. Observing a match, one can immediately recognize that harm is almost unavoidable, and sometimes boxers suffer lifelong health consequences. Critics believe that encouraging such violence for public entertainment is unethical, and that modern entertainment should no longer require two people hurting each other. On balance, although boxing can have positive influences for some, I lean toward the view that its dangerous nature makes it inappropriate today, and society should focus on safer ways to achieve the same benefits.

Question: Boxing is a blood sport which often results in physical injury. It is inappropriate for this sport to exist in the modern age.Do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Boxing is a sport that draws many visitors and a steady stream of new athlets. But that might be suprising, since it is a violent sport that often results in serious injuries of the participants. As a developed society, who at large condemns fighting, the continued interest can be seen as undermining our values and beliefs.
While using fists to communicate is definitely inappropriate people claim, that this is not what happens in a boxing match. Everybody who steps into the ring consents to the physical altercation and is aware of the risks associated with it. Furthermore, there are precautions taken and a jury in session to make sure nobody gets seriously hurt. Those points cause many fans of the sport to claim, that it is not so differnt to most other sports since there is always a possibility to get hurt. Additionally, one might argue that what two consenting adults do in there past time or as their job is just nobody elses business.
On the other hand, people who don't think boxing should continue, often are convinced that society sets the wrong incentives. The promise of fame and quick money that is often associated with a career in boxing might tempt some to disregard their long-term health for short-term gain. Since socially disadvantaged individuals are less likely to have alternative prospects, one might argue that it is not a real choice after all. Another concern of critics is the corruption of the audience. Frequent exposure to violent entertainment is often connected to a higher likelyhood to become violent.

AI Essay: Boxing, frequently criticized due to its violent nature and risk of serious injury, is believed by some to be a relic of a less civilized time. However, I do not think it is inappropriate for this sport to exist today. Like many other high-risk activities such as rock climbing or motor racing, boxing is fundamentally based on the informed consent of the participants, who are trained and understand the dangers involved. In fact, professional boxing organizations enforce strict safety rules and medical protocols to minimize harm. Many fans argue that the sport builds discipline, mental strength, and provides countless young people—often from disadvantaged backgrounds—an opportunity to find purpose and escape difficult circumstances. Admittedly, the lure of quick fame and fortune does have drawbacks, as does the fact that some spectators become desensitized to violence, but these issues are present in other areas of entertainment and sport as well. Ultimately, as long as there are regulations to protect boxers and participation is voluntary, I believe society should respect their choice and continue to allow boxing.

Question: Boxing is a blood sport which often results in physical injury. It is inappropriate for this sport to exist in the modern age.Do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
There is debatable issue as to whether boxing, a seemingly bloody sport, should be excluded from the modern society. As far as I am concerned, the attempt to remove boxing from the current age is utterly unjustified.
Admittedly, boxing is often associated with various disturbing factors, such as foul language, disregard to rivals, violent punches and inelegant appearance as a result of intense physical contacts. However, such gory scenes may frequently take place in underground boxing games which are barely recognised by the professional community of boxing and by the legal system. Unlike underground boxing, professional boxing upholds moral principles and universal values, for examples, respect to opponents, obedience of rules, etc. Also, professional boxers are protected by safety equipment and judges who may stop the game when witnessing any player suffering serious injuries. Therefore, the health hazards involved in boxing games may not be as severe as the public assumes.
Another reason reinforcing my position is that boxing already enjoys considerable popularity around the world and plays an important part in people's entertainment, as exemplified by the successful ticket sales of most boxing games and high audience rating of TV programmes broadcasting boxing matches. Given such popularity of boxing, the removal of this sport may cause widespread dissatisfaction and complaint.
To draw a conclusion, the exclusion of boxing is completely groundless and irrational, given the safety protection, sportmanship and popularity as reflected in this sport. I expect in the future, more views could arise to furnish the understanding in this regard.
AI Essay: There is considerable debate regarding whether boxing, as a physically violent sport prone to injury, has a place in contemporary society. Personally, I disagree with the proposition that boxing should be abolished for several substantive reasons. Modern boxing organizations mandate the use of protective gear and grant referees the authority to stop matches if a competitor is in danger, thereby minimizing extreme risks. Furthermore, boxing offers significant benefits such as instilling discipline, promoting physical fitness, and providing opportunities for individuals from disadvantaged backgrounds to achieve success and recognition. Notably, many renowned boxers—such as Manny Pacquiao and Muhammad Ali—have used their boxing careers to make positive contributions to society. Finally, boxing remains deeply embedded in culture and enjoys a passionate global following, with countless fans regarding the sport not solely as a spectacle of violence but as a testament to strategy, resilience, and sportsmanship. In light of these factors, eliminating boxing from modern society would disregard its regulated environment, its ability to inspire and uplift, and its lasting cultural significance.

Question: Competitiveness is a positive quality for people in most societies. How does competitiveness affect individuals? Is it a positive or negative trend?
Essay:
There are many factors to encourage the quality of societies, some people believe that competitiveness is the main factor to improve communities. The following essay will focus on importance of competitiveness on individuals and cite my opinion which believe that it is a positive trend to develop societies.
First of all, if you want to improve a skill of an individual in the differnet aspects of life like sport, you should play him with higher level to develop his talent and get best of him. For example ,a famous tennis table player from my town said in an interview, that he improved his talent when he played against his older brother, he was working hard in training sessions to reach the higher level, the standard that his brother plays in order to beat him and win games. The competetion between him and his brother lift up his skills and strenthgen his mentality.
secondly, competitions may create good atmosphere and healthy climate for children to improve thier abilitie in study. For example, my daughter and her friends in the class were struggling in studying math, the math teacher found a way to make the math more interesting for students, the teacher announced for a competition every day at the end of lesson, she writes an equations on the board and gives prizes for students who can solve them. Nowadays, my daughter is enjoying to solve math problems. Furthermore, competitions can improve people's career, and increase company's outcome, some managers tend to encourage competitiveness between employers to have more benefits for company and workers as well.
To conclude, competitiveness enables people to improve their talents and students to love what they study, also employers will develop their skills, as a result of that most societies will get more benefits of this trend.
AI Essay: Competitiveness plays an important role in many societies because it motivates people to do their best and reach new heights. On an individual level, when someone is surrounded by others who are striving to succeed, it can push them to work harder, practice more, or study with greater focus, all of which lead to personal development. For instance, one of my classmates who always wanted to get the best grades was inspired to study more seriously because he noticed other students in our class were also dedicated, and as a result, his performance noticeably improved. Furthermore, a competitive environment can make activities more enjoyable and give people a sense of achievement when they accomplish their goals. However, competitiveness can also have negative effects if it becomes too intense, leading people to feel stressed or anxious if they are not always on top. Some people may compare themselves too much with others, which can sometimes decrease their confidence. Even so, I believe that, when managed properly, competitiveness is a positive trend because it pushes individuals beyond their comfort zones and ultimately helps both people and communities advance.

Question: Competitiveness is a positive quality for people in most societies. How does competitiveness affect individuals? Is it a positive or negative trend?
Essay:
Competitiveness is a desirable quality for individuals. This essay will analyse the effects of competitiveness on people and illuminate my view as to whether the eagerness of competition represents an auspicious or ominous tendency.
There are mainly two types of influence exerted by competitiveness on people. The most prominent repercussion resides in that the desire of competition drives people to work or study more diligently in order to stand out from the rest and achieve success. Such diligence enables people to accumulate sufficient experience that helps them improve capabilities and obtain better results. Apart from that, another important effect of competitiveness is that competitors may seek considerable pleasure in competition, especially when defeating competent rivals and obtaining hard-earned victories. Such success makes people realise how excellent they are and gives them tremendous satisfaction. Even if losing the competition, people may still be satisfied with such a precious opportunity that helps them understand their disadvantages and thus, encourages them to work harder.
As far as I am concerned, I opine that competitiveness is a positive phenomenon, because it not only helps people become industrious learners or workers with sufficient experience and great potential of making progress, but also makes their daily lives more enjoyable as beating strong opponents may give them a unique sense of satisfaction. Therefore, I think that the importance of competitiveness should never be underestimated.
To sum up, the effects of competitiveness can be manifested by the impetus driving people to work or study harder, and the unique pleasure of competing against strong rivals. Personally, I hold that this is an auspicious trend.
AI Essay: Competitiveness is widely regarded as a beneficial attribute in modern society. This essay will discuss how competitiveness influences individuals and express my viewpoint regarding whether it should be perceived as a favourable or adverse development. To begin with, competitiveness often motivates individuals to elevate their performance in various aspects of life, such as academics, work, or sports. By striving to exceed others or their own past achievements, people frequently set higher goals, leading them to exert greater effort and perseverance. This can result in increased skill, knowledge, and personal growth. In addition, competitiveness can foster innovation and creativity, since the drive to outdo others may stimulate new ideas and approaches. However, competitiveness may also bring about negative consequences; for example, excessive rivalry can lead to stress, anxiety, or damaged relationships, particularly when individuals become overly focused on winning at all costs. Despite these potential downsides, I believe that competitiveness, on balance, is a positive force. It encourages people to challenge themselves and discover their true potential, while also enriching society through improved outcomes and dynamic progress. In conclusion, although competitiveness can sometimes have harmful effects, its capacity to drive improvement and ambition makes it a valuable trend in contemporary life.

As for being positive or negative, I am of the opinion that competitiveness is a positive trend due to numerous reasons. AI Essay: The concept of competitiveness has become more significant as modern societies place a higher value on personal achievement. Some believe it propels individuals to reach greater heights, while others argue it may cause unnecessary stress. Personally, I think competitiveness mostly benefits individuals by inspiring them to exceed their limitations and pursue self-improvement. For example, during my time at university, constant competition with classmates motivated me to study harder and search for innovative solutions to problems. In the professional world, companies such as Apple and Samsung compete with one another, which results in better products and more technological innovation for consumers. However, too much competitiveness sometimes leads to anxiety, jealousy, or poor teamwork, especially when people become obsessed with winning. Nevertheless, if managed properly, competitiveness encourages learning, fosters perseverance, and often brings out the best in people. In conclusion, while competitiveness can occasionally have negative consequences, I believe that its positive effects for personal and societal progress make it an overwhelmingly beneficial trend.

Question: Competitiveness is a positive quality for people in most societies. How does competitiveness affect individuals? Is it a positive or negative trend?
Essay:
Life is full of competition. Soon after the release from competitive university exams, the hard fighting for higher positions in a company will be waiting for you. While the competitiveness has been bringing us a convenient society, no small number of employments have been tired of never-ending competitions. No doubt about a positive effect on societies, but when we start to argue about the effect on individuals, it becomes more controversial. This essay will argue the drawbacks of competitiveness for individuals, especially from the perspective of Japanese modern society and typical Japanese office workers. I believe that cooperativeness and uniqueness are sometimes more important attitude than competitiveness.
Firstly, competitiveness causes less diversity. If there is a competition, there must be the same evaluation metrics to differentiate winners and losers. The evaluation procedure needs to limit the metrics into specific aspects of the human being. Therefore, it is extremely difficult to prove that the metrics are proper for all of the possible cases and effective for the HR evaluation. For example, Japanese companies are likely to judge quantitatively based on the numbers related to performance. However, how can we evaluate the cooperativity or the non-quantitative performance like in creative jobs? Most Japanese companies adopted the HR evaluation methods based on average working hours per day and number of reports monthly. That’s why the Japanese tend to overwork to fulfill this requirement. In addition, as a result of placing more importance in quantity of reports, rather than quality, Japanese employees are prone to choose easy and short-term tasks or outsourcing instead of building by their own methods. This tendency causes fewer complicated and long-term tasks.
Secondly, competitiveness causes less cooperativeness. Fewer people volunteer to play a disadvantageous role for smooth teamwork. Moreover, some people play an evil role by blaming or cheating the competitors in order to be superior to them. As a consequence, overall efficiency will decline and some people will be overestimated. Even if there are no problems temporarily, the long-lasting large companies will eventually become corrupt, and those who have the most political power, rather than real power, will remain at the top.
Consequently, competitiveness is the basis of capitalism which brings us a brighter and more convenient society, however, biased evaluation and less cooperative working environment possibly drive people into nervous breakdowns. Karoshi, overwork death derived from too much stress and less sleeping, is one of the most serious social problems in Japan. We may need to rethink about the competitiveness.
AI Essay: Competitiveness is often celebrated as a driving force behind personal achievement and societal progress, yet its impact on individuals can be both profound and complicated. In many modern societies, particularly in places like South Korea, the drive to outdo others shapes educational systems and workplace cultures alike, leading to widespread stress and burnout. While a competitive spirit can motivate people to learn new skills and push past their limits, it can also result in narrow definitions of success, often measured by test scores or productivity milestones. This focus on ranking and comparison tends to devalue qualities such as collaboration and empathy, which are essential in teams and for creative problem-solving. For example, in South Korean high schools, students often sacrifice personal hobbies and social relationships to perform better than their peers on exams, and this pattern often continues into corporate life. As a result, many individuals become isolated or experience mental health issues, undermining both personal well-being and social cohesion. While some degree of competition is necessary for innovation and improvement, an excessive focus on outpacing others can ultimately erode the foundations of trust and shared purpose, which are just as important for a thriving society. Thus, although competitiveness has certain advantages, its negative effects on individuals’ happiness, cooperation, and mental health suggest that societies should strive for a better balance between competing and collaborating.

AI Essay: Competitiveness is often regarded as an essential quality in developing societies, pushing individuals and nations toward progress and innovation. However, the effects of competitiveness on individuals are more complicated than they may appear on the surface, and whether it is a positive or negative trend depends greatly on context. While healthy competition can encourage personal growth and excellence, excessive focus on outperforming others can create significant stress and undermine well-being. For instance, in many workplaces, employees are rewarded for surpassing colleagues instead of cooperating with them, which can lead to a loss of trust and less willingness to share knowledge. In such an environment, creative thinking and teamwork often become secondary to the pursuit of personal recognition. This problem can be observed in South Korean academia, where students are under relentless pressure to outperform one another on highly competitive exams. Though the country has excellent educational outcomes, many students experience mental health issues, and some even disengage from social life altogether. On the other hand, a moderate level of competitiveness can inspire people to set higher goals and reach their potential, provided it is balanced with supportive structures and the recognition of diverse talents. In conclusion, while competitiveness has contributed greatly to development and efficiency, its impact on individuals should be carefully managed to avoid negative consequences like alienation, stress, and a lack of true collaboration.

Question: Traffic and housing problems could be solved by moving large companies, factories and their employees to the countryside.Do you agree or disagree?
Essay:
Many metropolises are facing challenges, including traffic gams and serious lacking of housing available for families to live, particular in the developed countries. The governments are looking for a way to lessen the volume of traffic in the cities and to increase the number of housing provision over the metropolises. Some people advocate the businesses including large corporations and factories along with their employees moving to the suburbs which is the best way to figure out the metropolitan problems. Is this a sheer solution for these challenges faced by the cities?
Economy boom in a country is accompanied with a number of problems incurred in the cities due to the multitudes living in there. It is no wonder that metropolises represent more job opportunities available and better education system to next generations. These are strong pull factors appealing people to stay in the cities despite the higher cost in living. A larger number of populations in the cities not only result in a severe shortage of housing where there is a higher demand of housing over the available supply, but also bring the higher volume of traffic across the cities, particular in a peak hour when a thousand and one employees commuting to work and students going to schools. Some people believe the working location shifting to rural areas is a solution that enables to lessen the frequent usage of roads in cities. Simultaneously, it is assumed that the housing issue can be solved naturally arising from the migration of their employees into the suburban town next to their working place.
The business allocated to suburbs alone is rarely considered enough to tackle these problems. A place to live requires the basic facilities to serve for clothing, food, housing and transportation which are basic needs of human. If there is a working place and residential area only in the suburban town without any infrastructures, people have no choice to drive their vehicles back and forth between cities and their living places for the general consumption. As a consequence, the traffic congestion in cities will be worsen combining with the significant deterioration of air quality in the countryside due to an increase in the emission of the greenhouse gases. Therefore, the governments play a key role to establish a neighborhood which could be self-sufficient communities outside of their larger metropolitan areas. This may be a feasible and effective way to minimize the metropolitan issues.
My own view is that the shifting strategies in suburbs can help lessen the challenges faced by metropolises. But the governments should take the smart planning into consideration in which the employment bases with the living infrastructures are developed in the suburban town.
AI Essay: Traffic and housing issues have become two of the most pressing concerns in major cities worldwide, leading some to argue that relocating large companies, factories, and their employees to the countryside could offer a solution. While at first glance this proposal might promise relief, the reality is far more complex. The clustering of job opportunities and better social amenities in urban centers is a strong magnet for populations, driving both high housing demand and overwhelming the transportation networks. If organizations and their workers move to rural areas, the immediate effect may be some reduction in urban congestion and housing shortages. However, this approach ignores the need for robust infrastructure in the countryside, such as roads, public transport, schools, and healthcare, which do not currently exist at the same scale as cities. Without thoughtful development of comprehensive facilities, employees may be forced to commute long distances or rely on city resources, merely shifting the problem elsewhere or even exacerbating it through increased traffic between rural and urban areas. Moreover, sudden population growth in once-quiet rural communities can strain local resources and alter the environment, potentially leading to new sets of difficulties. In my opinion, although relocating companies to the countryside can play a role in alleviating some urban stress, it is not a standalone solution. Governments must couple such moves with careful urban and regional planning, ensuring that employment bases are matched with sustainable housing, infrastructure, and social services to prevent recreating the same problems outside the city. Only a balanced, long-term approach can truly address the root causes of metropolitan traffic and housing issues.

Question: Traffic and housing problems could be solved by moving large companies, factories and their employees to the countryside.Do you agree or disagree?
Essay:
It is often argued that by moving large companies,factories and it employees,traffic and housing problems could be irradicated.I completely agree to this fact that these problems could be solved by taking this step.
Traffic and housing problems has been a major problem in big cities due to the increasing population in these areas.The main contribution to the rapidly growing population are the multinational companies and the industries that have been set in the cities.These companies have a thousands of employees.As a result,if these companies are established in cities,it will lead to lot of traffic.For example,mumbai,a major city in India has uncontrollable traffic due to the vast IT sector present there.It has been very difficult for the people living in mumbai to travel even the shortest distances as it takes a lot of time to move from one place to another.The demand for housing also increases due to large number of employees from industries and huge companies which inturn leads to drastic increase in the expenses for housing.As a result,they have to compromise for small houses due to high rents.
The only solution for this problem is by mobilising the big companies and industries to countryside which has a lot of empty lands.By taking this step,it is both benefitial to the companies as well as the employees.The cost of establishment of the companies will be significantly low in the outskirts of the cities and the rural areas compared to the city.The employees also save a lot of time due to relatively less traffic and they also benefit to a large extent by low housing exenses.The traffic, housing problems and the pollution in the cities will also be reduced by taking this initiative.
To conclude,the employees, the people in the citiesand the companies as a whole could benefit by mobilising the industries and multinational companies from the cities to the country side due to the above reasons.
AI Essay: Many people believe that relocating large businesses, factories, and their workers to rural areas could help solve the traffic and housing problems experienced in cities. I fully agree with this opinion, as moving companies out of urban areas will greatly reduce congestion and the struggle to find affordable homes. The main reason big cities suffer from heavy traffic and expensive, overcrowded housing is the high concentration of major companies, which attract thousands of employees into the city every day. For instance, in cities like Beijing and London, roads are always jammed during rush hours, mainly because everyone is heading to a few business hubs located downtown. This daily migration not only slows down transportation but also puts pressure on public transit and raises pollution levels. Moreover, the large number of workers searching for housing near their offices has pushed rental prices to unaffordable rates for many people, often forcing them into cramped living conditions. By moving these companies to the countryside where land is more available and cheaper, the pressure on urban infrastructure will decrease. Employees can enjoy larger homes at lower costs, companies will benefit from lower land and construction prices, and cities can potentially become less crowded and more pleasant for those who remain. Therefore, I believe that encouraging firms and their staff to relocate to rural areas is an effective way to tackle the persistent issues of urban traffic and housing shortages.

Question: Some people think that it is more beneficial to take part in sports which are played in teams, like football, while other people think that taking part in individual sports, like tennis or swimming, is better. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
Essay:
Sport play an essential role in shaping the personality of individual. Some people believe that sports which are played in teams are more beneficial like football, while others think that solo sports like tennis or swimming is better. The following essay will discuss both arguments and give my opinion that sports which are played in teams have more advantages over solo sport activites.
First of all, there is no doubt that the individual sport activities enahnce people confidence. It helps building the personality and strentghen the mentality of the individuals. For examole, one role model in my home country was playing tennis table, he mentioned once in an interview, that sport helped him not only to win trophies but it raised his mental strength and shaped his pesonality.
However, some people believe that, sports which are played in teams
have more advantages and all community will get the benefits. Soccer, for example, will help the players specifically the young children to understand working together and sharing the responsibility. In addition people will grow with better understanding to the concept of sharing achievements which can improve all the community. For instance, i was a member of soccer team in high school, me and my friends were taught, in order to win games we should put plans together and work as one unit. Furthermore, it helps me later in my career to understand the meaning of leadership and how the sharing responsibility and working together could bring the success to our endeavour.
To conclude, solo sport can bring proud and honour to individuals but
sports which played in teams teach people the meaning of working together which will improve the community in the future.
AI Essay: There are different opinions when it comes to choosing between team sports and individual sports. On one hand, individual sports like tennis or swimming can help a person gain self-discipline and push themselves to improve since they are solely responsible for their results. For example, when someone practices swimming, they learn how to set personal goals and work hard to achieve them, which can help boost their confidence and determination. On the other hand, team sports such as basketball or football teach people how to work with others and value cooperation. Being part of a team requires communication, understanding, and the ability to handle both winning and losing together, which are useful skills not only in sports but also in life and work situations. Personally, I believe that team sports are more beneficial overall, because they nurture social skills and a sense of community, which are important for both young people and adults. In the end, while both types of sports have their own advantages, taking part in a team sport has a bigger impact on developing important life skills.

AI Essay: There are those who argue that engaging in team sports such as football is more advantageous, while others believe that solo activities like swimming or tennis are better for individuals. This topic is important because it concerns not only physical health but also the development of interpersonal and personal skills. Participating in a team sport aids in teaching valuable lessons such as cooperation, communication, and shared responsibility, as players must rely on each other to achieve common goals. However, not everyone prefers or thrives in a group setting, and for some, individual sports offer greater opportunities for personal discipline and mental focus. In tennis or swimming, athletes are solely accountable for their own progress, which can help them develop independence and a strong sense of self-motivation. Nonetheless, individual sports may sometimes feel isolating, as athletes do not always share their achievements or failures with others. In my opinion, both types of sports have their unique benefits, but team sports are somewhat more helpful overall because they not only encourage physical fitness but also contribute to the building of essential social skills that are useful in many aspects of life.

Question: Some people believe that giving longer prison sentences is the best way to reduce crime. Others believe that there are better ways to reduce crime. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
Essay:
Some people believe that giving longer prison sentences is the best way to reduce crime. On the other hand, others believe that there are better ways to reduce crime. This essay will discuss both views and my opinion.
Some people insist that punishment is a priority as culprits have gone agaisnt ones country's law. When they serve more years in prison, there is no chance for them to re-commit crime. In addition, some suppose that those who can not afford themselves, will feel better in the prison. As prisoners have to live in a systmatized cycle, they do not need to plan their budget and life. There is interview with an offender who continuously commits crime to go back to the prison.
Contemporarily, others say that there are better ways to reduce crime, such as rehabiliation and education. Most offenders lack moral value. Furthermore, they mostly have wrong mindsets or thoughts as some have never been educated properly. Therefore, other people think that education is better way to improve prisoners' behaviour. Society ought to give an opportunity to re-start their life again.
I agree more with the second view. Obviously, we have to punish those people whoever break the law. However, punishment should not be a priority. Education is important. Community need to lead a way for them so that they can re-born as a totally different person. There is a statistics of crimes rates in the United States of America which implicits that strict punishment and longer prison sentences reversely led to an increase in crime rates. Therefore, the government needs to concentrate more on education and rehabiliation rather than security and control.
AI Essay: Some people argue that giving longer prison sentences is the most effective way to reduce crime. They believe that strict punishment discourages people from breaking the law, as the threat of more time in prison acts as a strong warning. This group also feels that when criminals are locked up for longer, society becomes safer because these individuals are not free to commit more crimes. On the other hand, others think there are better solutions to reduce crime, such as investing in prevention and support. They argue that many who commit crimes have difficult backgrounds, like poverty or lack of education, and that programs for rehabilitation or job training can help people avoid becoming repeat offenders. In my opinion, while prison is necessary for serious crimes, it should not be the only solution. Focusing on education, mental health support, and providing opportunities for those at risk can address the root reasons for crime and help people make better choices. Therefore, I support the idea that combining fair punishment with helpful programs is the best path to creating a safer community.

Question: Some people believe that giving longer prison sentences is the best way to reduce crime. Others believe that there are better ways to reduce crime. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
Essay:
There is an opinion which is that the longer prison sentences is the best solution to reduce crime. On the contrary, some people say that there are better solutions to solve this problem. Overall, I totally agree with the latter opinion because I think that giving long prison sentences can not directly reduce crime.

Even if they would commit crime, they would have to be in prison for long days. In addition, living in prison for a long time may give a time to reflect themselvs for them.
However, if crimers would be in the prison for a long time, it might be difficult for them to make them living on themselves because they might not be used to the social reality. It may cause them to commit crime again.

Then, people have many burdens because of woriking, raising their children and caring their parens. AI Essay: There are people who believe that the best way to reduce crime is to put criminals in prison for as long as possible. In my opinion, finding the reasons why people commit crime and helping them make better choices is more effective than only relying on long prison sentences.

AI Essay: There are different opinions about how to best reduce crime in society. Some people argue that longer prison sentences will discourage people from breaking the law because they are afraid of losing their freedom for a long time. For example, countries with harsh punishments may see people thinking twice before committing a crime, since the risk feels too great. Question: Some people believe that giving longer prison sentences is the best way to reduce crime. Others believe that there are better ways to reduce crime. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
Essay:
The increasing number of criminals are appeared in a society where some people advocate the longer incarceration resulting in a reduction of crime. However, some are divided and think that a number of better ways can help lessen the cases of crime. Which strategy should be taken to tackle this problem? This essay attempts to explore the view of both sides.
An increase in the rate of crimes is a raising concerns in the community. A longer prison sentence seems to be the straightforward method to impede the crimes caused. In fact, a continuous incarceration is no room for offenders to commit the crimes in the community. This seemingly becomes an immediate achievement in the short term period. Some people deeply believe the mindset of criminals can be eliminated by the deterrence effect of the longer sentences which deprive of a person's freedom in life. In addition, it is generally recognized that the offenders have to be punished in effect of their guilty acts. The outlaws deserve a lengthening prison term in which they repent their offenses resulting in a decline in the number of crimes.
Indeed, the incarceration can limit the offender's actions in a place at some points. However, it is not difficult to find there is a higher rate of reoffending upon release from prison across the countries. In 2013, the U.S.A. had a reoffending rate of 52% which prisoners reoffended within a year of release with a record of 49.2% in the U.K. The proportion of reoffenders occupied nearly a half of criminals. It reveals that the prison sentences is not a effective way to decrease the number of criminal cases. This implies that a decline in the crimes can be achieved araising from a decline in the likelihood of reoffending. Rehabilitation during the course of their sentence can be adopted to tackle this problems. These include direct therapeutic interventions to address the psychological causes of criminal behaviours as well as services to prepare offenderes to successfully reintegrate into the community after release. Those actions include the provision of academic programmes, vocational courses and employment opportunities.
My take on this is that the incarceration alone is rarely considered enough in the control of criminal cases. A longer prison term only increase the financial cost from the government, but it cannot lower the likelihood of criminal offenses. The governments have to address the root factors causing offenses is the prime issue to reduce the crimes.
AI Essay: There are differing opinions about how best to tackle growing crime rates, with some arguing that longer prison sentences are the most powerful way to deter criminals, while others believe alternative strategies are more effective. Supporters of extended imprisonment contend that harsh punishment discourages potential offenders and keeps dangerous individuals off the streets for longer periods, which could bring immediate relief to the public by reducing crime in the short term. They also maintain that strict penalties serve as a form of justice for victims and a warning to would-be criminals. On the other hand, critics highlight the high rates of repeat offenses among ex-prisoners, which suggests that imprisonment alone might not solve the underlying causes of crime. They argue that addressing issues like lack of education, unemployment, and poor mental health through targeted rehabilitation programs, skills training, and community support can have a more lasting impact. In my view, while longer prison sentences might temporarily restrain offenders, real progress in reducing crime likely comes from a combination of reasonable punishment and comprehensive efforts to help individuals reintegrate into society, thereby tackling the root causes of offending.

AI Essay: The debate on how best to reduce crime in society remains widespread, with some asserting that lengthier prison sentences are most effective, while others propose alternative approaches for better results. Supporters of longer incarceration argue that harsher punishments deter potential offenders by instilling fear of severe consequences and that keeping criminals off the streets for longer periods ensures public safety. Question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which they are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
Essay:
Today, the advertising has become very powerfull thanks to the television and the internet. But is it true that it is now more important in terms of sail rates, than the goods themselves and the actual requests of the society?
First of all, I think that usually in the one selected price range, all the products serving the same purpose have more or less equal properties such as quality or taste. This is indeed true, for example, for many electronic devices which are are produced by the nearby factories somewhere in China regardless the brand, and therefore their sales depend more on marketing strategies.
However, if the one buys the goods of well known brand, he trusts the experience beneath this brand. This is a kind of assurance that a consumer gets excactly what he expects and that a product is not defective. For instance, when choosing the car, you probably would firstly consider BMW or Mercedec. The reason why you know them is not only good advertising, but also quality proved by millions of clients throughout the years.
Moreover, I believe that modern society actually moves towards the conscious consumption. This implies people becoming more and more awared of product and its manufactoring process ratheer than advertising. From that the decreasing of the aggressive marketing follows, though the marketing still has cruical role. In fact its focus changes so that it will become more informative and less disturbing in the future.
In conclusion I want to disclose my own point of view. I do agree with the topic to the certain extent, though I am sure advertising is only a one reason of high sales, among many others and its influence will decrease with time.
AI Essay: It is often claimed that the popularity of modern consumer goods is due mostly to advertising, rather than the true needs of society. While I acknowledge that advertising is indeed a powerful tool and influences many purchasing decisions, I do not fully agree that it outweighs genuine demand in every situation. For example, items like smartphones or bottled water are purchased not just because people see them on billboards but because they fill a practical need in daily life. On the other hand, many similar products are available, and consumers tend to choose the one they have heard about more often, which shows the effect of repeated exposure in advertisements. Nevertheless, there are also cases where advertising cannot save a bad product, as people will quickly stop buying it if it does not meet their expectations, no matter how flashy the commercial is. Furthermore, as people become more informed through reviews and social discussions on the internet, they often rely less on advertisements and make smarter decisions. In conclusion, while the role of advertising in high sales is significant and sometimes leads consumers to buy things they do not really need, real-life usefulness and quality are equally important factors that advertising alone cannot replace.

Question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which they are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
Essay:
There is no doubt that nowadays advertising plays a very strong role in saling goods. The high rate of sales does not always mean the real needs of some goods. In this essay, i will discuss both views and draw my personal conclusion.
In terms of advertising's power in increasing sales of popular consumer goods, advertising has an essencial role these days in sales. The main reason given to support this claim is advertisnig attracts people and inform people about the new and special products in a very special way. To illustrate, using social media for marketing and advertising raise sales dramatecly. People spend most of their times to watch what is in the social media and that means social media is the best way to do your marketing.
However, some people say that people buy these products not because they really need them but because they like the way that was used to advertise these products. On the other hand, some times people purchase goods because they have seen them or heard about them from others or from the social media not due to their needs of these products.
In conclusion, I believe that increasing the sales of some popular consumer goods show how strong is advertising and how advertising plays a crucial role in saling products. Also, smart business owners should think about advertising as a fast way to sale their goods. As was previously menthond, people can be attracted by all kinds of advertising and that definitly lead to increasing the sale rate.
AI Essay: It is often argued that the impressive sales figures of many popular consumer items today are largely due to the influence of advertising rather than actual necessity. Personally, I tend to agree with this viewpoint for several reasons. Firstly, advertisements are designed to create a desire for products by highlighting features that appeal to emotions or lifestyles, rather than actual needs. For example, many people are persuaded to buy the newest smartphone not because their old one is broken, but because the ads make them feel that owning the latest model will make them happier or more successful. Furthermore, the constant presence of advertising on television, social media, and the internet means that people are always being encouraged to buy more, often items they previously never considered. However, it is also true that some goods do fulfill real needs within society, such as food and medical supplies. In conclusion, while basic necessities are indeed driven by need, I strongly believe that the high sales of many popular products today mostly reflect the effectiveness and power of modern advertising rather than true necessity.

Question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which they are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
Essay:
Based on some alledges, publicity is the main reason for the high rate of selling not humans' requirements. Although in my point of view, commercials are impressive in realms that people are looking for to address their demands. However, some other factors are uttered here.
One of the most highlighted contributors has to do with the high quality of accepted brands among their rivals. To enlighten, some domestic brands that have been even supported by both public and similarly authorities never can compete with other abroad commodities, as, not only in the real of quality but in terms of price also they cannot attain any level among other imported things. For instance, individuals' usage of fast foods has skyrocketed in the last decade, due to the lack of time for cooking, hence the development of takeaways is eye-catching while the number of their customers has swelled sharply.
On the other hand, whereas advertising has been effective for some international firms, it would not be feasible if the improvement of transportation did not emerge. To illustrate, the main role is played by second-to-none commuting systems for delivering divergent products, therefore without their assistance, introducing goods to other parts of the universe seems to be meaningless while society does not have access to them as their choices.
To conclude, while publicity, nowadays, is exploited as a means for enhancing the chance of selling in different markets, to me, it is impossible to become prosperous if folks do not need those things. Nevertheless, other justifications that are associated with the appeal of various merchandise, namely their quality, should not be ignored.
AI Essay: There are those who claim that the overwhelming popularity of many consumer products can be best credited to the influence of advertising, rather than the actual needs of people in a community. While I agree that advertising holds significant sway in shaping purchasing choices and creating a sense of necessity, I believe the situation involves additional critical aspects. Firstly, it is undeniable that advertisements, particularly through social media and celebrity endorsements, can create desires for items that might not be essential, such as the newest smartphone models or branded athletic wear. However, it is equally important to consider people’s genuine requirements, which may coincide with the features promoted in popular goods. For example, technological advancement demands devices that enhance efficiency, and brands extensively promoted often fulfill such requirements due to their renowned reliability or innovation. Furthermore, consumer trends are influenced by cultural changes and evolving lifestyles, like the rapid adoption of smart home devices which not only reflects successful marketing but also meets the modern need for convenience. Beyond the power of advertising, factors such as product availability, after-sales service, and the overall reputation of brands play pivotal roles in high sales figures. In essence, while advertising undoubtedly amplifies demand and sometimes invents new expectations, I do not believe it alone determines what people buy; lasting, widespread popularity of consumer goods arises from a combination of effective promotion, genuine consumer needs, and the practical value these products provide.

Question: The tendency of news reports in the media to focus more on problems and emergencies rather than on positive developments is harmful to the individuals and the society as a whole.To what extent do you agree or disagree?
Essay:
In recent years, news reports on TV programs and news papers tend to focus on incidents and emergencies rather than positive developments. In Japan, because of this phenomenon, many people are influenced this country might be more dangerous than they thought. I disagree with these tendencies and should focus on more positive developments, including entertainment.
To go into detail, in Japan, once people turn on the TV in the morning. People face often face some news reports about a murder case, who were murdered, who is the criminal, and background details. In addition, there are more than 5 channels on TV, these all 5 channels broadcast the same incident at the same time. The Japanese government might take the control of media in order to agitate people to keep their attention on safety. It might be important to some extent, but it is not necessarily a good influence on people's mind if they were required to watch such a fierce, and negative incident every morning.
In contrast, when it comes Japanese crime rate, and case. They reached a peak of 2014, and keep decreasing until now. The cases are not significant derrence, compared with a few dacase ago. In addition, almost Japanese crimes tend to be petty crimes, such as thefts, frauds, shop lifting, and so on. In terms of the murder case, Japan is ranked as the 5th safest country among 160 countries in 2017. This means that the more media reported the savage crimes, people misunderstand Japanese society is getting more dangerous than a few decades ago.
Finally, it is understandable to report such a heavy incident to some extent. On the other hand, they should also report positive and attractive news, such as tourism, especially inbound sales figures has been increasing and contributing to Japanese economic growth, and some Japanese athletes have been successful in MLB(major league baseball), and football. This news must be more fascinating for Japanese people to encourage their own national identity.
In conclusion, this is not a black-and-white issue. But it might be more beneficial for people's minds to be positive. If some heavy incidents happened, the Japanese government should restrict TV companies to broadcasting only one channel, or limit the time shorter.
AI Essay: In modern society, the tendency of media to emphasize negative news, such as disasters and crimes, more than positive events greatly affects how individuals view the world and themselves. For example, in many countries, including Japan, people often start their day being bombarded by news about economic troubles, political scandals, or tragic accidents. This creates a perception that the world is unsafe and filled with problems, even though many positive developments are also happening every day. Personally, I believe this focus on negative news is harmful, as it increases anxiety and makes people overly cautious or even distrustful of others. Furthermore, when society continuously hears about dangers, they might lose hope in the possibility of positive change, ignoring achievements in technology, community efforts, or scientific discoveries that could inspire them. While it is important for the news to alert society about real risks, I think a more balanced approach, including good news, would support mental well-being and help people feel more optimistic about the future. Therefore, I agree that too much focus on negative issues in the media is damaging and a shift towards highlighting positive stories is necessary to create a healthier and more hopeful society.

Question: The tendency of news reports in the media to focus more on problems and emergencies rather than on positive developments is harmful to the individuals and the society as a whole.To what extent do you agree or disagree?
Essay:
News reports in the media focus on problems and emergencies more often than on some positive events. Is it really harmful to the individuals and the society as a whole?
Let us consider the purpose of the media existence first. I suppose it is to spread important information, so that people may use it in their lives. And problems are usually more important than some positive developments, since, in fact, they are the things which people should be aware of in the first place. For example, due to the COVID, which is an international problem, many people lost their jobs. If they had been notified about the rising of pandemic though, they would have prepared somehow (save more money by cutting unnecessary expenses, learn a new profession and so forth).
Moreover, I believe problems shall be solved. And when people are concerned about some problems, they may tend to face them with honor and participate in solving them. For instance, the energy crisis is a huge problem, and it is important to aware society of it, so that individuals could try to be more careful with gas and electricity. In the end, society will benefit from it, so it is not harmful.
On the other hand, there is some negative impact of bad news on individuals sometimes. But I am sure it should be considered as psychological issues of particular individuals, rather than a problem of today's media system. People just should not fall in despair because of news reports, but think how they could take an advantage of the provided information to minimize a negative impact and help humanity to solve problems.
Finally, in my view, the stated tendency is not really harmful to society, but it may sometimes be harmful to the individuals, and they are responsible for it.
AI Essay: The tendency of the media to report more on problems and emergencies rather than positive news draws criticism for potentially harming individuals and society. However, I largely disagree with this view because the main function of news is to alert the public to urgent issues that require attention. For example, if the media had not focused so heavily on reporting wildfires in Australia, many residents would have been unaware of the danger and unprepared to evacuate. News about problems serves as a warning system and often encourages public debate and action, helping society address its biggest challenges. Of course, constant exposure to negative news may lead to feelings of anxiety in some people, but this problem can be managed by individuals learning to limit their news intake or seek balance. Additionally, problems and emergencies usually require collective knowledge and response, so highlighting them is beneficial for the common good. Positive developments are indeed valuable, but they often do not demand immediate changes in behavior. Therefore, I believe that while an excess of negative news can affect moods, the media’s focus on problems is generally not harmful and even helps drive societal progress.

Question: The tendency of news reports in the media to focus more on problems and emergencies rather than on positive developments is harmful to the individuals and the society as a whole.To what extent do you agree or disagree?

AI Essay: It is clear that the media overwhelmingly concentrates on reporting problems and emergencies, while positive developments are often ignored or placed in the background. I strongly believe that this trend is damaging not only for individuals but also for society as a whole. When people are continuously exposed to negative news stories, such as crimes, natural disasters, or scandals, they may begin to perceive the world as more dangerous and miserable than it actually is. This constant exposure can lead to increased anxiety and a lack of faith in humanity or the possibility of improvement. Many individuals, especially those who routinely follow the news, might feel powerless and discouraged to contribute to their communities, believing that nothing they do will truly make a difference. On a larger scale, this negative focus can harm society by weakening trust between citizens and also between people and their institutions. If only societal failures are shown, citizens may lose motivation to participate in civic life, and the sense of community can be destroyed. Moreover, consistently negative portrayals can fuel stereotypes and judgments about entire countries or groups, creating further divisions. If the media were to balance their coverage, highlighting positive stories and progress along with challenges, both individuals and society would be more optimistic, cooperative, and resilient. For these reasons, I am convinced that the current approach of prioritizing negative news leads to real harm for both people and the wider community.
