AI Essay: Many people believe that since people are now living longer, the retirement age should be increased a lot, but I do not fully agree with this idea. In my opinion, although life expectancy has gone up, this does not always mean people are able to work effectively for more years. First, as people age, their physical abilities often decline. Even if someone is healthy, tasks that require standing for long periods, increased concentration, or lifting heavy things can become very challenging. For example, an older nurse or construction worker may struggle to keep up with the physical demands of their job, which could put them at risk for injuries. Second, staying longer in the workforce could make it harder for young people to find jobs. If older people keep working, there may not be enough job openings for younger generations who are just starting their careers. Finally, after working many years, people deserve to rest and enjoy time with family or travel, which would not be possible if they had to work much longer. In conclusion, I think the retirement age should stay as it is so people can retire while they are still healthy and let younger workers have more opportunities.

Question: Some say that because many people are living much longer, the age at which people retire from work should be raised considerably.To what extent do you agree or disagree?

It is argued by some people that because nowadays people live longer than they used to, retirment age should be raised. In my opinion, I think that companies should use other measures to determine the right time for retirment.
In recent years, many companies have set rules for retirment age. This is because these companies believe that when people reach a certain age they do not performe as good as younger employees. As a result, many experianced employees lose their jobs, which can affect both employees and companies. For example, some companies require experianced employees to retire at the age of 60, which can lead to loss of valuable knowlege that can be used to train younger employees. To solve this problem, companies can use different measure to help them decide when to ask their emplpyees to retair or resign.
On the other hand, I believe that companies should focus on their employees performance and work quality, rather than their ages. The reason for this is that companies should retain well performing employees, which has nothing to do with age. For instance, companies can monitore their employees work quality as a way to meaure their ability to continue working. As a consequence, companies would have a stronger performance compared to other companies who use age as a measure, this is because they will have experianced and well performaing employees at the same time.
In conclusion, while companies uses ages to measure when it is the right time to retire, I believe that other measures such as performance and work quality should be used.
AI Essay: Some people believe that since life expectancy has increased, people should work for more years before retiring. However, I disagree with the idea that the retirement age should be raised for everyone simply because people are living longer. It is true that older adults may be healthier nowadays and able to work past traditional retirement ages, but there are many factors to consider. For instance, certain jobs require a lot of physical effort or high concentration, and employees may struggle to perform well as they grow older. For example, a construction worker or a nurse may experience difficulties doing their job effectively in their late sixties. Moreover, not everyone wants or needs to keep working into old age, and everyone’s personal situation is different. Instead of increasing the retirement age for all workers, I believe it is better to offer people the choice to retire when they feel ready or to continue if they are willing and able. In this way, both companies and their employees can benefit from more flexibility rather than creating a strict rule for everyone.

Question: Some say that because many people are living much longer, the age at which people retire from work should be raised considerably.To what extent do you agree or disagree?
Essay:
People nowadays are living much longer.
With the discovering of new medicine and with the innovation in the medical field, the life expectancy of a person skyrocketed over the last decade.
Some people might think that the consequence of this phenomenon should be the fact that the age at which people retire from work ought to be raised considerably.
I don't agree with this idea.
Rather than involving the life expectancy of a person, we should consider the job itself.
Is it tiring? Does it require a person to be able to react immediately to a potential problem?
If the job is tiring I think that it would be better for a person to retire. If you end up being worn out every day because your job is very exhausting the life expectancy should not be the fact that decides if you have or not the right to retire.
The question ought to be: Is the person physically and mentally able to cope with the work?
The older you get the slower you become. This is another pivotal factor that should be taken into account when deciding the retirement age of a person.
The ability to react to dangerous events keeps the working environment under control.
Let's imagine a carpenter working on the construction of a new building.
What if a wall suddenly falls? Does an elderly person react faster than a younger worker?
I am an optimistic person but I would stick to my guns in this scenario betting on the younger person.
I would like to wrap up this essay by saying that I could have thought of many more reasons that explain why the age at which people retire from work should not be based entirely on the fact that people are living longer.
Of course, this can not be ignored but basing this decision only on this fact it is seen by me as a poor approach.
AI Essay: It is true that average life spans are increasing in many countries today due to advances in healthcare and improved living conditions. Some people argue that because people are living longer, they should also work for more years before retiring. However, I believe this is not necessarily the right solution. The ability to continue working until a later age depends not just on longevity but on health, job type, and personal circumstances. For example, someone who has a physically demanding job may not be able to perform well into their late sixties or seventies, regardless of life expectancy. Mental exhaustion is another factor. People who work in stressful environments may burn out earlier and need rest and recovery after years of service. Moreover, increasing the retirement age could make it harder for young people to find jobs if fewer positions become available. It is also important to consider quality of life, as many people look forward to retirement to spend time with family, travel, or pursue hobbies. In summary, although people are living longer, I do not think this alone is a good enough reason to raise the retirement age considerably. Decisions about when people should retire should consider many different aspects, not just average lifespan.

New York is a metroplis and an apotheosis of consumerism and material extravagance, but there is an extreme disparation between the poor and the rich. In fact, numerous people live on the street arising from the higher cost of living in New York. The government have obligation to figure out a matter of unequal distribution in wealth.
My take on this is that a healthy country cannot concentrate on the production of products only, short-term target. The other community's concerns, including the unequal distribution of the wealth and the prospects of the youth, play an important role in the country. It is reasonable to say that a nation's goal should take a long term development, rather than the immediate achievement.
AI Essay: It is widely believed that the main aim for any nation should be escalating the output of physical goods and materials. Proponents argue that boosting production results in economic strength, generating more jobs and improving the living standards of citizens. The increased commercial activity also usually leads to higher government revenues, which could then be invested into crucial public services like healthcare and education. However, I believe that an endless pursuit of production may not necessarily lead to greater national welfare. Purely focusing on manufacturing can drive environmental degradation and resource depletion, which jeopardizes the well-being of future generations. Furthermore, the quality of life depends not just on the quantity of goods produced, but also upon social justice, equal opportunities, and sustainable practices. Some highly developed countries exhibit immense wealth, yet still face issues like environmental pollution and social inequality. Therefore, while expanding material production can be beneficial for economic growth, it should not be the sole or ultimate objective. A balanced approach that values human development, environmental preservation, and equitable resource distribution is essential for the long-term prosperity and harmony of a society.

Question: Many people assume that the goal of every country should be to produce more materials and goods.To what extent do you agree or disagree that constantly increasing production is an appropriate goal?
Essay:
More materials and goods are produced by a country that seemingly represent a sign of wealth and prosperity. A vast number of people believe continuously increasing production should be the ultimate target to all nations. This enables to improve the country's economy and their citizens' livelihood. Whereas some people are deeply divided on it. This essay attempts to look at the main considerations of both sides.
It cannot be denied that mass production on materials and products in a country presents a certain capability of their businesses and industries which have sufficient human and financial resources to develop the country's local economy. In other words, there is a higher rate of employment in the country. The funding from taxes can be used by the governments to fulfill the community's various concerns. This enables to gain the government's prestige from the public. As a consequence, it urges the governments to constantly intensify in the economic development resulting in an increase of their popularity.
An increasing production for materials and commodities alone is raraly considerd enough to reinforce the economic development of the country in the long run. The well educated manpower is an indispensable factor of the economy. The youth who are with the innovative mindset and worldwide view is a dynamic force of the economic development in the future. It is essential for the goverments to cultivate the younger people through higher-quality universal education and academic freedom, instead of focusing on the current and short term achievement.
In addition, the improvement of the country's economy cannot solve all issues of the community. Not only is there concerns about the rate of domestic employment in the country, but also there is concerned with the quality of lives for their civilians in the community. My take on this is that a healthy country cannot concentrate on the production of products only, short-term target. AI Essay: Many people hold the opinion that continually raising the production of goods and materials should be the main priority for any nation. This view is understandable, as economic growth is typically driven by manufacturing and industrial activity, providing citizens with jobs and allowing the state to collect higher tax revenues. These resources can then be invested in infrastructure and public services, creating a generally higher standard of living. However, it is important to consider the potential drawbacks of focusing solely on increased production. Overemphasizing the creation of goods can lead to the neglect of environmental concerns and the depletion of natural resources, resulting in negative consequences for both citizens and future generations. Moreover, constant production growth can create significant social issues, such as wider income inequalities and a loss of cultural identity. While boosting production plays a vital role in national prosperity, it is not the only measure of success. In my opinion, sustainable development, investment in human capital, and a more equitable distribution of wealth should be seen as equally important goals. Therefore, I partially disagree with the notion that increasing production alone is the most suitable ambition for countries, believing that a more balanced and forward-thinking approach is necessary for real and lasting progress.

Question: Many people assume that the goal of every country should be to produce more materials and goods.To what extent do you agree or disagree that constantly increasing production is an appropriate goal?
Essay:

On the one hand, countries rely on the economy in order to make money, provide people with jobs and make a way of living. So I believe production of material and goods is essential in every economy. Nevertheless, constant increasing of production is not very healthy for the country, as it may end in a surplus of goods and materials. Moreover, the situation could get worse if companies would not know what to do with all the excess products.
On the other hand, taking care of inhabitants of a certain country is as important as producing. Without health, education and values, most nations would not survive. I also believe that you cannot have a strong economy without a healthy population, as people are the ones that work in production. In other words, both aims complement each other perfectly.
As a conclusion, I would like to highlight the fact that constantly increasing production does not benefit anyone, it also may harm people. And governments should be more aware of other complex issues like the ones mentioned above.
AI Essay: There is a common belief that a nation should always focus on producing more goods and resources, as this is seen as a sign of progress and success. However, I do not fully agree that constant growth in production should be the main ambition of every country. While it is true that economic development is important because it creates jobs, provides income, and improves living standards, unlimited emphasis on production can cause serious problems. For example, increasing production without regard for the environment can lead to pollution and the depletion of natural resources, making life worse instead of better for everyone. Furthermore, social issues like healthcare, education, and equality are just as vital to a country’s strength as the economy. In fact, if a nation ignores these areas and focuses only on producing more, the consequences might be a less educated or unhealthier population who cannot contribute effectively to the economy anyway. Therefore, I believe the goal of a country should be to find a balance between economic growth and other areas like social welfare and environmental protection, ensuring both prosperity and quality of life for its people.

Question: Write about the following topic.Buying things on the Internet, such as books, air tickets and groceries, is becoming more and more popular.Do the advantages of shopping in this way outweigh the disadvantages?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
First of all,online shopping is somthing that people do to havre fun or sometimes thay just do not have the time to go to the department shops but there is advanteges and disadvanteges for it.
Firstly, the advanteges of online shopping is that u can save time and energy because online shopping is a conviniant way to get what you want from the internet without even going to the store by yourself to get what you want u could just click a putton and u will get all what you need.However, online shopping also have a lot of disadvanteges such as, order dalays,sometimes it comes in the wrong time like when you are not at home or when you are sleepy ,there is also this advanteges that its so commom which is wrong order ,its when you order somthing but it doesnt come instead there is another thing comes without even order it .Furthermore, the quality that you did not expected it or the color that u have seen it in the website but when it comes its completly not the same that u have saw in the website so some company lie a lot about these things (quality and colors).
Last but not least, in my opinion i think that if u really want to shop online you first have to see if its a good website or not you should also check if its safe or they will just stole you .In the other hand there is the department shops its more comfortable and more safe.
AI Essay: These days, more and more people are buying things online like books, plane tickets and groceries, which brings both benefits and problems. One advantage is that shopping on the internet is very convenient because you can buy anything from home at any time, especially if you have a busy schedule. For example, I remember buying a last minute birthday gift for my friend online because I did not have time to go to the mall. Another good thing is that it’s easier to find cheaper prices or special deals on the internet since you can compare different websites in a few minutes. Even so, there are some disadvantages, like waiting for delivery, which can take days or even weeks, and sometimes parcels get lost or arrive damaged. Plus, it is common to worry if the product will look different in real life or if your personal information is safe. While online shopping can sometimes be disappointing, I think the advantages are more important because it saves time and gives more choices. In conclusion, shopping online is very popular for a reason, and as long as we are careful, the benefits are greater than the risks.

Question: Write about the following topic.Buying things on the Internet, such as books, air tickets and groceries, is becoming more and more popular.Do the advantages of shopping in this way outweigh the disadvantages?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Nowadays, more and more people have started to do shopping online. In my opinion, buying products such as books, clothes or air tickets on internet have a lot of advantages that could balance the disadvantages.
Firstly, one of the positive aspect is that online it is possible to compare the same product at different prices in order to chose the best deal. Furthermore, we have the possibility to buy in a faster way, without wasting time and finding the best article. Indeed, in local shops it isn't always possible to find what we are searching for, while in the large shopping centre the research of the right thing takes time and it isn't so easy.
Another advantage of shopping on the Internet is that in a single website, such as Amazon, you can find multiple types of product, from book to clothes or furniture. In this way you can buy different things without spending too much time moving from one place to another.
On the other hand, buying online could have some disasvantages. For example, on the shopping websites there are lots of spam messages that offer you products at special prices. This kind of offerts are very attractive and make you to buy things that you really don't need. Also, not all the online platforms are secure and there are a lot of hacker that could steal your personal details.
In conclusion, I think that the advantages of shopping online outweigh the disadvantages, but we have to pay attention and chose carefully the websites in which spending our money in order to avoid problems.
AI Essay: Shopping on the Internet for items like books, air tickets, and groceries is becoming an everyday habit for many people, and I believe that this way of buying things has more advantages than disadvantages. One major benefit is the convenience—people can order anything from anywhere at any time, which saves effort and precious time, especially for those who have busy lives or do not have easy access to local stores. For example, my family often buys groceries online since it is much quicker than spending hours going to the supermarket and waiting in lines. Also, online shopping allows consumers to compare prices easily and hunt for discounts, something that can be difficult when shopping in physical stores. In addition, there is usually a wider selection of products on the Internet, meaning customers can find exactly what they want without having to visit multiple locations. On the negative side, there is a risk of receiving items that do not match the description or are of lower quality, and sometimes personal information can be at risk if the website is not secure. However, most reliable online shops now offer good return policies and improved security measures. All things considered, I think the benefits of online shopping, such as convenience, choice, and time saving, are stronger than the drawbacks, especially if people make purchases from trustworthy websites and are careful with their personal data.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some organisations believe that their employees should dress smartly. Others value quality of work above appearance.Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
The way in which we dress has always been under a social relevance we cannot avoid. Since the antiquity clothes showed the difference social status of people and now they are a way in which person can show her personal attitudes. It is difficult to valuate the role of clothing in work places. On the one hand, there are organisations that strongly believe that the employees must dress in a peculiar, smart way. On the other hand, there are work places in which how people who worked there are dressed does not matter.
Although I believe it is important to be dressed in the right way with respect with different social moments, I strongly insist that a person must not be judged because of her syle.
Organisations who require a particular dress code in the work place, are moved from the idea that the way in which you are dressed show your personality more than you can imagine. In particular, they believe that to ask people to be smartly dressed will present the organisation itself as serious and reliable. Moreover, in some work-place the heads insists in requiring a style that will not say a lot about the personal attitudes of the employees. Then, to have a particular skirt or to wear a fency pair of shoes will show up the particular attitudes of a person and this could be evaluated as a weakness by different managers. For instance, there are offices in which all the employees has to wear suit and tie if men and skirt and heel if they are women. However, sometimes this way of acting cause troubles and emotional deseases that can affect the employees who are not confidend in wearing clothes that respect that particular dress-code. One of the most famous case in Italy concered the flight company Alitalia who asked the woman empoyees to always wear the skirt. Just after several strikes they obtained the permit to wear also pants.
On the other hand, there are organisations in which how employees are dressed does not matter at all. They believe the skills possessed by the workers go beyond a particular pair of shoes. To take another example, the skills of an employee have nothing to do with the color of her hair. Places like this consider a point of streengh the emotional and personal attitudes of the workers as well as they strongly believe that to show personal attitudes in a work context can give a major value to the work itself. Then, they decide to leave free people to dress as they want without any restriction.
In conclusion, I believe that the tendency to rule the way in which people should be dressed in the work place must be operated with high awarness. the CEO of an agency can propose an office syle without compromise the particular attitudes and feelings of the employees.
AI Essay: The question of whether employees should dress smartly or if their quality of work matters more is a common debate in modern workplaces. Many organisations insist on professional attire because they think smart dress projects a good image for their company to clients and customers. For example, banks and law firms often have strict dress codes, believing this formality helps build trust and shows respect for the organisation and its clientele. On the other hand, some companies, especially in creative or technology fields, allow employees to dress casually, focusing instead on the results employees achieve. For instance, in many tech startups, workers may come to the office wearing jeans and T-shirts, but they are highly valued as long as they meet or exceed their targets. Personally, I think a balance is necessary. While appropriate dress can be important in certain roles that require face-to-face interaction with customers, I believe that the quality of the work is ultimately the most important factor. If employees are productive and contribute positively to the organisation, what they wear should not be the main concern, unless their appearance directly impacts the company's image or operations.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some organisations believe that their employees should dress smartly. Others value quality of work above appearance.Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Manners in the workplace have always been a topic that is discussed by many people as it is essential to know how we should behave in such a formal environment. Some companies give the opinion that their workers should have a smart look while others consider the attitude toward the job more important.
To my mind, appearance should not the only thing to be considered. We can dress smartly and impress others, but it is only the first impression. Therefore, productivity, quality of work, and the way we are responsible for our tasks are things that make us outstanding workers. Moreover, it is obvious that the success of one company does not depend on how its employees dress but on how it is organized.
In spite of the fact that dressing does not play a key role in the value of a worker, a neat and intelligent appearance still gives us significant benefits. I always suggest that one should dress suitably in different situations. In fact, it is not crucial for an organization to ask their employees to dress formally, but a set of smart casual clothes is something that we should wear when it comes to the working environment. It is because that wearing politely shows how we respect our jobs, our employers, and even our workmates. In some cases, a company's professionalism can be seen through the way its workers wear.
To sum up, dressing smartly is not the best and only thing that one worker can do to have better performance. However, having a good appearance is something that great employees would do since it can be considered as their respect for the jobs.
AI Essay: Some organisations argue that employees should present themselves in smart attire to maintain a professional image, thinking that how one dresses reflects not only the individual but the company as a whole. On the other hand, many workplaces are now putting more importance on the actual quality of an employee’s output, believing that talent, responsibility, and creativity are what truly drive a company’s success. Personally, I think while it is beneficial to look tidy and put together, it is much more essential to focus on the substance of the work. From my own experiences, especially in creative or tech-driven fields, I have noticed that teams often function better when people feel comfortable, even if that means dressing more casually. Yet, I understand there are industries, such as banking or law, where appearances can influence trust and credibility. Finding a balance could be the best approach, allowing some flexibility in dress codes without overlooking the value of first impressions. Ultimately, the real measure of any employee should be their dedication and results, not just their appearance, but dressing with a certain level of respect for the workplace can still make a positive difference.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some organisations believe that their employees should dress smartly. Others value quality of work above appearance.Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
It is commonly believed, that companies should have dress code policy for the employees, whereas some people consider that the quality of employees' work is more important, than the appearance of the employees.
I think there might be some advantages to have a dress code, but disadvantages overweight benefits in this case.
First of all, dress code policy mandatory for some organisations' workers as it's part of the safety policy. For instance, workers of some scientific or technical labs should wear some specific dresses as their job is with the dangerous chemical elements. The absence of the protecting dress or some details, such as glasses or gloves, might be harmful for the employees. In this case, I believe to have harsh rules for the dress code, is essential.
Turning to the drawbacks of the dress code, I would mention that it might be uncomfortable and as a result effect on the employees' work quality. For instance, some banks require female employees to wear heels' shoes or male employees to have a tie. This kind of dresses or dress' elements might be not comfortable for the employees and as a result to have a psychological negative impact, such as lack of attention or willingnes to work properly . This will lead to the decrease of the work quality.
Another drawback of the dress code, is standartisation, when all employees should wear the company uniform with company logo. In this case, employees do not have opportunity to show their unique appearance and identity as all employees have approximately the same appearance. This might have again it's negative impact on workers' perfomance.
In conclusion, there might be some benefits to have a dress code, but most of all I see drawbacks of this policy, as it might effect on the employees' work quality negatively. I recommend that, companies should consider employees opinion as well before puting into practice dress code policy.
AI Essay: Some organisations insist that employees dress smartly because they believe that neat appearance gives a good impression to clients and shapes the company’s overall reputation. For example, in customer-facing sectors like hospitality or sales, looking professional helps to build trust and project competence. On the other hand, many companies are more concerned with the employee’s performance rather than how they dress, arguing that comfortable clothing allows staff to concentrate better and be more productive. For instance, technology firms often allow casual dress since their focus is on innovation and results, not appearances. I personally agree with the latter view, as the most crucial factor is the quality of work, not the clothes someone wears. Though presenting oneself neatly can be essential in certain roles, I think forcing everyone into formal attire can cause discomfort and reduce morale. Therefore, it is better for organisations to offer flexible dress codes that respect both the nature of the business and the preferences of their employees.

Question: Write about the following topic.Psychologists have known for many years that colour can affect how people feel. For this reason, attention should be given to colour schemes when decorating places such as offices and hospitals.How true is this statement?How far does colour influence people’s health and capacity for work?
Essay:
The role of colors in our psycological life is crucial. Some people suggest hence to pay attention on color schemes when workplaces or hospital are decorated. I agree that colors affect people's psychological health. A particular place's decoration can arouse a determinate feeling that could favour or penalise the capacity of people in a work place.
Colors affect our psycological life. They possess an extraordinary social role. It is not a case that the famous table of emotions is presented in different colors where the different colors represent different emotions. For instance, blue incline people to be sad while red is said to be the color of passion, and move strongly the emotions of a person by setting of her pleasures. Lastly the grey's shades stimulate anxiety. Therefore, I think that the hospital's walls or officies cannot be decorated in grey or blue as long as it is better to stimulate their positiveness and productivity. Thre is a curious story about Princess Sissi, that confirm the impact of color in our life. She was obsessed about her wight and fitness. For this reason, she decored purple all the walls of her appartmanets. Indeed, pourple is said to be the color which stimulates the absence of hunger. Thus, when the princess was there it was easier for her to be fast.
By contrast, there are also some colors that stimulate fantasy, creativity and peace. Green is one of that color. Then, to decorate hospitals with green shades could be a good way to produce positive vibes in people who are sicks. Moreover, yellow is defined as the color that describes the feeling of being proud, aware and confident. Then, using this color in the walls of the officies will stimulate workers to do their better. Their capacity in the work-place will be maximased by the general environment.
In conclusion, I believe that colors affect our psychological life and then people should pay attention in the feelings they stimulate when they decore a room or a building intented to welcome a particular type of people like sicks people or workers. Psychological life is important and relevant as the physical one and colors can affects our moods as well as physical accidents do.
AI Essay: It is widely recognized that colours have a significant impact on how people feel, and psychologists have long studied the effect of different colour schemes on human emotions and behaviours. Based on this, I think it is reasonable to pay special attention to the use of colour in environments like offices and hospitals, where the psychological wellbeing of people plays a vital role. Colours such as blue and green have been shown to have calming effects, which can help reduce anxiety and promote healing in places where people are often stressed, such as hospitals. In contrast, bright and bold colours like red or orange can encourage alertness but may also increase agitation if used excessively. When it comes to productivity and concentration in workplaces, colours like light blue or soft green promote a relaxed atmosphere, helping people focus better on their tasks, whereas dull and monotonous shades may cause feelings of depression or boredom, lowering efficiency. Nonetheless, it is important to recognize that individual preferences and cultural backgrounds can also influence how someone reacts to a certain colour, so a one-size-fits-all approach might not work everywhere. Overall, while colour is not the only factor affecting health or work performance, it certainly has a noticeable influence and should be considered carefully when designing spaces meant for recovery or productivity.

Question: Write about the following topic.Psychologists have known for many years that colour can affect how people feel. For this reason, attention should be given to colour schemes when decorating places such as offices and hospitals.How true is this statement?How far does colour influence people’s health and capacity for work?
Essay:
The colours and its affect on humans feelings always interested the psychologists and become a part of their researches. This researches get the attention of the organizations and help them to shape their designs of their offices or buildings. In this essay, I will talk about the affects of colour and its influence on some parts of human's life.
It is true that certain colours are affecting our mental state and feelings at some level. Because of our visual plays an important role in our pyschology, colours are becoming important issue that needs to be point out. For example, the alertness effect of red colour on human's feeling is well known by the goverments. In order to alert people, stop signs or traffic lights are always include some level of red colour. This way, humans can be warned and accidents numbers can be decreased.
Also, this affect of colours can play a big role in our health and work place. To give an example, the infinity effect of white colour is always used by hospitals. They paint their desks, tables, rooms, bathrooms or walls to white colour most of the time. This way, they calm their patients and help them to relieve their stress. Another example is grey. It is one of the favourite colour of the companies. They use this colour mainly in their office to make sure their employees are not distracted so they can finish their task.
To conclude, colours are very affective in our mood and feelings. They are being used by the organizations to benefit from this effect.
AI Essay: The impact of colour on human emotions and behaviour has long been studied by psychologists, and many organisations now take this into account when planning spaces such as hospitals and offices. Colours can act as visual cues, influencing whether a person feels calm, alert, or even anxious. For example, blue and green are often considered soothing and are frequently used in hospital rooms to create a peaceful and healing environment for patients. In workspaces, bright colours like yellow can promote energy and creativity, while more muted tones like grey or beige may help employees stay focused and avoid unnecessary distractions. Although not everyone responds to colour in exactly the same way, there is strong evidence that colour schemes can influence people's health by reducing stress and improving mood, as well as their capacity for work through enhanced concentration or motivation. In summary, careful choice of colour in shared environments is an effective way to support well-being and productivity.

Question: Write about the following topic.Information technology is changing many aspects of our lives and now dominates our home, leisure and work activities.To what extent do the benefits of information technology outweigh the disadvantages?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Improving technology is the tendency of the era right now. Information technology is one type that has already changed a lot from the past. Information technology influences our daily life in many areas, such as home, leisure, and work activities. It positively affects human life, but it also has its disadvantage. I will give my opinion about how information technology influences our lives and the information technology has more benefit or cause more detriment.
Information technology improves human life in many different areas. First, it reduces the difficulty of communication. The technology we have right now gives us a faster and easier way to communicate with other who is far from us. Right now, whether we use social media or email, we can contact the people who are far from us immediately. The second part is information gathering; right now, we can get news everywhere, just on electronics, such as cell phones and TV. Also, information technology helps humans in information storage and process. This is the advantage of information technology.
Information technology significantly improves human life, but it also has some disadvantages. The first thing is to reduce the time people commute together face by face. Nowadays, classes, meetings, and work can all go online. As a result, we have less chance to meet and communicate; this reduces the ability to watch others' behavior and expression to speculate their feeling and emotion. The second disadvantage is that convenient technology lets people rely on it too much and reduces our ability to finish jobs without technology.
In my opinion, the advantage of information technology has way more influence on human life than the disadvantages. First, it helps us solve our problems with more accessible and faster information. This meets the fast rhythm of life in this era. Also, information technology may let people rely on it, but this is very general for humans because we always use anything we can use to solve problems quicker and more efficiently. This is how information technology influences our life.
AI Essay: Information technology is rapidly transforming almost every aspect of daily life, affecting how people communicate, work, and relax. While there are certainly drawbacks to this level of dependence, I believe the benefits of information technology greatly outweigh the disadvantages. For instance, with the rise of smartphones and computers, people are able to easily keep in touch with friends and family across long distances, making the world feel much smaller and more connected. At work, advanced software and online tools enable employees to be more productive, communicate instantly, and even work remotely, which saves time and reduces stress from daily commuting. In addition, entertainment has become more accessible, as people can enjoy movies, music, and games from the comfort of their homes. However, there are problems such as people becoming less active or spending less time interacting in person. Overuse of digital devices can also lead to issues like eye strain or distractions from work or studies. Yet, many of these problems can be managed by setting boundaries and using technology responsibly. In my opinion, the ability to access information quickly, stay connected globally, and work efficiently means that the positive effects of information technology far outweigh the negatives.

Question: Write about the following topic.Information technology is changing many aspects of our lives and now dominates our home, leisure and work activities.To what extent do the benefits of information technology outweigh the disadvantages?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
There is no doubt that these days information technology has invaded our space and dominated our home leisure and work. However, the question: is dominating our lives by this technology have a negative or positive impact on our lives? Is considered one of the most controversial issues today. In this essay, I am going to examine this phenomenon from both viewpoints.
On one side of the argument, some people argue that the benefits considerably outweigh the disadvantages. The main reason for believing this is integrating technology in every aspect eases our lives and decreases hardworking. For example, advanced houses with integrated voice commands give the person the ability to achieve multiple tasks without any physical activity. Moreover, the technology allows people to connect multiple devices with an email address and control them remotely. One good illustration of that you can switch on and off your home AC while you are at work by the WIFI technology.
On the other hand, it is also possible to consider it with the opposing case. It is often argued that in fact using advanced technology increase the number of unhealthy people. People often have this opinion because people become lazier, and their daily activity dramatically decreases making them prone to diseases.
As we have seen, there are no easy answers to this question. On balance, however, I tend to believe that using advanced information technology should be limited to simple tasks, so at any point if a technical error happened you can resume your life without any obstacles.
AI Essay: There is no question that information technology has become a crucial part of our daily routines, from how we interact at home to the way we work and spend our free time. The main issue, however, is whether this significant influence brings more advantages or problems to our lives. On the one hand, supporters emphasize that information technology makes life far more efficient. With computers and smartphones, work can be completed remotely, allowing people to save time on commuting and improving their productivity. For instance, during the recent global health crisis, many people were able to continue their work and education online due to advanced technology. Furthermore, devices such as smart TVs and online streaming services provide endless entertainment choices without the need to leave home. On the other hand, some critics argue that there are real drawbacks, including increased social isolation and health concerns like eye strain and lack of physical activity. For example, excessive use of gadgets leads people to spend less time outdoors and interact less with family and friends in person. In conclusion, despite the possible negative effects, I am convinced that the benefits of information technology are greater because they provide flexibility, convenience, and opportunities for both work and leisure, as long as people are careful to maintain a balanced lifestyle.

Question: Write about the following topic.Information technology is changing many aspects of our lives and now dominates our home, leisure and work activities.To what extent do the benefits of information technology outweigh the disadvantages?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
With the growing prevalence of information technology, it gradually dominates every aspect of our daily lives. While it is admittedly true that when used inappropriately, technology may expose us to a host of dangers and thus complicate our lives, it is, however, necessary for us not to overlook the benefits of technology to society. Given that technology changes many factors of our lives, I strongly believe that the advantages of it outweigh the disadvantages.
In terms of mobile phones bringing people closer together, these technological devices enable people to stay in touch no matter where they are. In the past, when people have to use telephones to contact with each other, is now replaced with social media, which is a convenient alternative for communication. For instance, smartphone applications such as email or WhatsApp, an instant messaging service, help people in different parts of the world interact with one another. Therefore, wireless communication networks facilitate communication and make people's lives easier and more convenient.
Regarding time efficiency, computers are an expendient way for people to find information instantly. Comparing to the past when people spends hours a day in a library to look for information using books, we can surf the Internet now. As an example. Wikipedia is an online, open-source encyclopedia that lets people browse for factual knowledge, and SCMP.com is a website which lets people catch up on the latest news. Conversely, if people carelessly use the Internet, they will result in discovering false messages, which readily mistaken their perspectives.
Having discussed that information technology certainly modifies our daily lives, as well as the drawback of it, if people can use technology properly, I am confident that technology will better streamline people's daily schedules.
AI Essay: Information technology has become an integral part of modern living, influencing everything from our home environments to how we spend our free time and perform our professional tasks. Although it is undeniable that technology introduces certain drawbacks, such as increased screen time, the spread of misinformation, and risks to personal privacy, it also provides undeniable benefits that, in my view, outweigh these limitations. For example, at work, cloud-based collaboration tools like Google Drive enable people in different corners of the world to work together on projects in real time, thus improving both productivity and creativity. At home, smart devices simplify daily chores, allowing us to control lighting, temperature, and even security systems remotely. Moreover, leisure activities have evolved as streaming services and online games offer convenient entertainment options, connecting people even when they are physically apart. Admittedly, overuse of these technologies can lead to reduced physical activity or social isolation, yet with responsible management, these issues can be minimized. In conclusion, the enhancements to communication, access to knowledge, and convenience brought about by information technology contribute more positively than negatively to our daily lives.

Question: Write about the following topic.Information technology is changing many aspects of our lives and now dominates our home, leisure and work activities.To what extent do the benefits of information technology outweigh the disadvantages?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
The amount of space that information technology covers in our life is getting bigger everyday. We use techonology products at hour houses, work place, and even in our free times. They help us to connect with the people around the world and collect information in a high speed. On the other hand, it would makes us lazy if rely on them too much. In this essay, I will explain how we can benefit from information techonology so we can outweigh its drawback.
Humans are social creatures and technology is helping us to socialize with others world-wide. Computers and the internet are the two products of technology that we use to connect with our friends, families and people. Despite where we live in, in today's world, we are able to talk with our friends almost anytime we want it. As a person who lives abroad, this advantage of technology makes my life a lot easier and helps me to feel less homesick.
Furthermore, with the improvements in technology, we are able to find the information that we looking for online and this would take possibly less than a minute. Search engines such as Google and Yahoo, is very helpful in this case. We can search the information in these platforms rather than going to public libraries, and they would provide in a short period. This speed can help us to improve and gain more information.
However, we can find ourselves at our offices or homes, sitting in front our laptop all day and completing our tasks with a little effort. This habit would makes us lazy and inactive people. Our metabolism needs certain amount of excersise in order to burn calories and not gain fat. Addiction to technology, would take this need away and might cause an harmful health conditions in the future.
To conclude, technology addiction can promote the unhealthy life. However, I believe advantages such as speed of gaining information and providing a platform to connect people, eleminates its drawback.
AI Essay: Information technology is becoming a much more important part of our lives, affecting the way we live at home, how we enjoy our free time, and how we work every day. For example, we can easily watch movies online, communicate with friends using our smartphones, or finish work projects by using a computer and the internet. These benefits are very clear because technology gives us new chances to learn, talk to people, and even work from home if needed. I have noticed that I can study for my lessons faster by searching for answers on Google instead of going to the library, and I can stay in touch with my relatives even if they live far away. However, there are also negative sides such as spending too much time with technology, which leads to people not going outside or meeting each other face to face. This can sometimes make people feel lonely or cause health problems like getting less exercise. In my opinion, the advantages of information technology are greater than the disadvantages as long as people know when to take breaks and use technology in a healthy way, because the speed, convenience, and opportunities it provides strongly improve our lives.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some universities now offer their courses on the Internet so that people can study online.Is this a positive or negative development?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Nowadays, a good number of universities make their courses available online for people to study, which I believe its a positive step for many reasons, such as, spreading knowledge worldwide and providing free materials for students.
It is widely acknowledged that the internt can be a useful tool for learning. Taking advantage of the fast and variable resources and tools, many universities upload courses and materials in diverse fields of knowledge on the internet, so that any human anywhere can attend these courses and gain the information and expertise needed. For instance, anyone can attend a course from Harvard university and even acquire a certain degree online without having to travel to that university.
Furthermore, providing free online courses can contribute significantly to the society, by allowing students with low income families to be part of the educated community. Thus permitting more contribution to the world. A good example is the health care, psychology, and business courses given by Stanford university helped many people get their degree and be part of the workforce in these fields without paying expensive tuition fees.
In conclusion, permitting the knowledge to be widely available online is a useful development, as it will allow more individuals worldwide to access informations, and also by providing free courses to serve community by serving its poor citizens get their educational degrees.
AI Essay: These days, many universities offer their courses on the Internet, and overall, I think this is a highly positive development for several important reasons. First of all, making courses available online allows people from all over the world, including those living in remote areas or with busy schedules, to access quality education without the need to relocate or commute. For example, a person working full-time in a small town can now study engineering or computer science from a top university without leaving home. Secondly, online education often costs less than traditional classes, making learning more affordable for students who might not have enough money for expensive tuition and housing. In my opinion, this makes education fairer and more accessible for everyone. Additionally, online courses offer more flexibility, letting students learn at their own pace and review materials whenever they need. Of course, some people worry that online classes lack the personal interaction of face-to-face lessons, but many platforms now provide live sessions and discussion forums, so students do not miss out on collaborative learning. In conclusion, offering university courses on the Internet brings benefits such as wider access, lower cost, and greater flexibility, making education more reachable for people everywhere.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some universities now offer their courses on the Internet so that people can study online.Is this a positive or negative development?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Universities are offering many online courses for the convinience of people. Although online courses can never substitute the regular education, some benefits of online courses are undeniable. This essay will discuss both the advantegs and disadvantages of study through the internet.
Prima facie, education through internet has far more reach than any other method. Universities can approach students from all over the world, even a student from a remote area can be benefitted through the revolutionary internet courses. Online courses are also considered to be cost effective because a student can study from the comfort of home and save lot of living expenses.
While remote education reaches many students, it lacks in many ways. A physical classroom exeperience gives a student far more learning than the online one. Some practical subjects like Medical Science and Science require a lab facility and presence of students in the classroom environment. Theories can be still taught online but practical education is not feasible. Attending college also provides many mental health benefits, students connects with fellow studenst and teachers and create a social circle which in return result in healthy conversations and meeting. An healthy and happy environment is significant and helps people learn more quickly. Moreover a regular college education comes with many extra curricullar activities like sport, drama, music etc. I can never forget my college days where I enjoyed many youth festivals and sports event which helped in developing overall personality. Colleges provied many other benefit like socail gathering and focus on behaviroul aspect of students as well.
In a nutshell though online education comes with some good feature but can never replace the physical/regular education system.
AI Essay: Studying online through university courses on the Internet is becoming more popular today, and in my opinion, this is mostly a positive development. One main advantage is that online courses make higher education more accessible for people who cannot attend classes in person, such as those who live far away or have jobs and families to take care of. Students can learn at their own pace and save money on things like transportation and accommodation, making university study more affordable for many families. However, studying only online is not perfect because some important aspects of university life, like making friends, asking questions face-to-face, and doing practical work, are more difficult or even impossible on the Internet. For instance, laboratory experiments for science students require special equipment that students usually do not have at home. Nevertheless, I think giving students the option to study online is good because education becomes more flexible and adaptable to modern life. Personally, I have taken an online history class, and I found it helpful because I could watch lectures whenever I had time. Overall, while there might be some challenges, the expansion of online courses generally improves opportunities for people to get an education, making it a positive step forward.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some universities now offer their courses on the Internet so that people can study online.Is this a positive or negative development?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Nowadays, many universities allow people to follow some courses and study totally online. In my opinion, this way of studing has both positive and negative aspects. This essay will argue why studing online can be unproductive for people.
The first reason why studing online is not good for a student is that is easier for him to lost the concentraiton during a lecture. For example, last year beacuse of the pandemic period, all students had to get class online, including me. It was a terrible year, because I stayed at home all the time and became very difficult listening lectures due to lot of things that capture my attention during lessons.
The other reason why getting class on the internet is a negative development is that the direct interaction between people is absent. I feel that this is the biggest drawback, because students are always alone in their room and they could become unsocial over the time. By contrast, the social life is important for everyone, because it help people to grow and share good and bad moment of the life. In addition, I think that is also important the dialoge with the teacher.
In conclusion, studing online can be a good solution for some people who need to stay at home and want to study at university, but in general it's a negative thing. In fact, is important for students to stay in a class with the teacher and other classmates to be concentrate during a lesson and to have the possibility to talk face to face with other people.
AI Essay: In recent years, universities have started to provide their courses through the Internet, allowing students to study remotely. I believe that this development has many benefits, but also some disadvantages. Firstly, being able to take classes online makes education much more accessible for people who cannot travel or live far from a good university. For example, last semester, my cousin who lives in a small town was able to join a well-known university in another country and study computer science from his own home, which would not have been possible without online lessons. However, there are also negative effects, such as reduced communication with teachers and classmates. When everyone is behind a screen, it can be hard to ask questions or make friends, and sometimes students feel lonely or less motivated. In my own experience last year, I missed the feeling of being with other students and discussing ideas face to face. In summary, offering courses online is a positive change because it opens opportunities for many students, but it also creates some challenges that should be considered to help students get the most from their studies.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some universities now offer their courses on the Internet so that people can study online.Is this a positive or negative development?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
It has become a popular trend that many universities have sent online courses for people to acquire knowledge through the Internet, which makes it more and more available for people to gain valuable resources and improve themselves. From my perspective, such a trend contains much benefits and it is undoubtedly a positive development.
On the one hand, people can have more access to their interested expertise and delve into related fields with the help of online courses offered by universities. It is comparatively hard and inconvenient for people to attend courses in the university if they are not college students. Luckily, with myriads of online courses which are usually free and of high quality, learners merely need to register and sign in to find out some interesting courses ranging from academic knowledge to practical skills, which can afford a challenging but exciting experience for those attend the lessons.
On the other hand, it is a good way for the universities to improve the quality of the courses as well as make some adaptation to the content of the courses. Thus, universities would therefore release more high-quality courses by innovating teaching skills to meet people's needs.
In conlusion, I think online courses provided by universities can surely make a positive impact on society because people who have the desire to acquire knowledge can enjoy sufficient resources without boundaries, which enhances individual's rights to grasp knowledge and facilitates the improvement of higher education in the long run.

Question: Write about the following topic.Some universities now offer their courses on the Internet so that people can study online.Is this a positive or negative development?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:

AI Essay: With the increase of technology in modern life, it is understandable that universities start to offer more and more of their courses on the Internet so students can study online if they need. In some cases this is very positive, for example, people who live far from the campus, or have full time jobs, now they can access the education much easier without have to change their life entirely. During the COVID period, all of us saw how important it can be for education to continue without face-to-face meetings, and many students appreciated to have online videos or zoom lectures. However, I find that moving all courses to the Internet is not always good. Some subjects, especially practical ones like engineering or medicine, really need to be learned in person. I remember my friend who tried to study chemistry online, but he always told me experiments are not the same from just watching a video. Also, studying together in classroom is a social experience that helps people make friends and learn from each other, which is never the same at home alone with a computer. In my opinion, online courses are convenient and a great tool if used together with traditional ways, but universities should keep the chance for students to experience real university life and face-to-face learning as much as possible.

Question: Write about the following topic.It is inevitable that traditional cultures will be lost as technology develops. Technology and traditional cultures are incompatible.To what extent do you agree or disagree with this view?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
As society becomes more and more saturated with technology, traditional cultures are losing their roles in society. The compatibility of technology and traditions are often debated where some suggest it is possible, whereas, others argue it is not. In this essay, I will discuss both perspectives and conclude by saying how and why it is almost impossible.
Since people usually appreciate limited ways of living, it is challenging for both conventions and technology to co-exist. They will usually choose one method or another but not both at the same time. For instance, a company would have to focus on using human labour or advanced machineries to produce a product. The incompatibility may not be obvious at first but as technology develops futher, use of machines will increase but employment will decrease. Furthermore, technology is often considered to be more convenient and faster by many people. Work can be done more efficiently so workers will start to abandon the old ways of living or working.
In contrast, it might be possible for two values to work along in society due to different tastes of various people. Traditional cultures are usually appreciated by old generation such as grandparents, meanwhile, new generation prefers technology in their life. For example, grandparents can read newspaper while grandchildren watch TV or play games during family time. Moreover, although it is hard for a company to use both at the same time, it is not totally impossible. If the number of machines is controlled during production, human labour and machines can work together to maximise productivity by covering up each other's disadvantages.
All in all, even though traditional values and technology can be compatible theoratically, it is indeed difficult to compromise the use between two in real life. Ergo, people would have to beware of the risk of losing traditional cultures, if at all.
AI Essay: With the rapid advancement of technology, many people fear that traditional cultures are at risk of disappearing entirely. Some argue that modern innovations and longstanding customs simply cannot coexist, suggesting that society must choose between embracing progress or holding onto the past. In my opinion, while technology can sometimes challenge traditional practices, it does not automatically mean that cultures must be lost; rather, they can adapt and even benefit from new tools. For example, many traditional festivals and ceremonies are now shared online, allowing younger generations to connect with their heritage in new ways. Additionally, the internet has made it possible for indigenous languages and stories to be recorded and passed down more easily than before. Still, there is some truth to the concern, as certain customs that rely on older ways of working—such as handcrafting goods or oral storytelling—may struggle to survive in a fast-paced digital world. Ultimately, although there are tensions between technology and traditional culture, the two are not inherently incompatible. Instead, the challenge lies in finding a balance that preserves valuable traditions while still taking advantage of technological advancements.

Question: Write about the following topic.It is inevitable that traditional cultures will be lost as technology develops. In fact, by tapping technology to make tradition far more attractive, considerably more audience will be engaged into such activities. Bologna is a case in point, since, thanks to digital machines and drones which have supported housewives into the making of , the traditional celebration of “making pasta day ” has recently being turned into a successful events, which draws people from country as far afield as China.

This can be put into practice by setting a direct connection to cultural heritage of a specific area of the world to those who do not have access easily. To this end, many primary schools in New York have developed a project in which, owing to the ultimate high speed connection, pupils who come from abroad can learn ancient craft directly from a master located in their country of origin.
To conclude, I firmly believe that traditional culture and technology development are widely compatible as the technology can positively beef up the presence of cultural traditions nowadays, so as to keep its memory Alive. In addition, pioneering projects can be implemented to underpin cultural awareness amongst youngsters.

Firstly, technology enables the recording and sharing of traditional music, dance, and storytelling, making it possible for people globally to access and learn about diverse cultures in ways that were previously unimaginable. For instance, Indigenous communities in Australia have used social media and digital archiving to share their languages and rituals, ensuring their continuation. In addition, technology can revitalize old customs by presenting them through new platforms such as virtual reality, allowing users to experience unique cultural ceremonies from their own homes. In conclusion, although thoughtful regulation is needed to avoid the commercialization of culture, I believe technology and traditional culture can not only coexist but also flourish together when leveraged thoughtfully and creatively.

Question: Write about the following topic.Extreme sports such as sky diving and skiing are very dangerous and should be banned.To what extent do you agree or disagree with this view?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Secondly, if such sports are conducted properly then it should not be as dangerous like there should be guidelines where they make sure that pieces of equipment are in excellent condition and where they do make sure a safety check.
Lastly, despite being extreme, many find themselves indulging in such activity because it helps them reduce their stress at work or home. The reason is that when we engage in sports, our body releases oxytocin, a hormone that alleviates stress and helps us feel more relaxed and peaceful unlike when we are bombarded with phone calls or emails from clients.
In conclusion, I disagree with the eradication of extreme sports as it provides thrills and also boosts someone's confidence as they move beyond their limitation. people all around the world love to indulge in such activities where they feel an adrenaline rush in their whole body.
AI Essay: Extreme sports such as sky diving and skiing are often criticized for being very dangerous, with some people arguing that they should be banned altogether. Many people also use these sports as a way to conquer their fears and challenge themselves, which can be very rewarding both mentally and physically. Rather than banning extreme sports, it would be better to focus on promoting education about safety and encouraging responsible participation. In summary, I believe extreme sports should not be banned, as they offer valuable opportunities for excitement and personal growth, as long as sensible precautions are in place.

Question: Write about the following topic.Most people have forgotten the meaning behind traditional or religious festivals; during festival periods, people nowadays only want to enjoy themselves.To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
Nowardays, it widely believed that most people have forgotten the main purpose of some traditions and religious celebrations, but during those festival periods they just prefer to enjoy themselves and have a fun from holiday. On the one hand, it seems that the majority of people does not care about the reason of holidays, they are ready to enjoy them without any concrete reasons. The second explanation to the issue can be that people follow some traditions from ancient times, so some of those traditions became as a routines, that the basic meaning could be forgotten during the times. But nations continue folloving some customs just because they got used to them, even if they do not remember the main purpose of the celebration. The third reason to that can be that young generation do not understand some of their ancestors traditions, so they just accept some festivals from their predecessors as days when they are able to make their lives brighter and enjoy themselves.
On the other hand, there are exist people who know the basics of festivals and familiar with the hystory of traditions in their countries. Such kind of people usually consern about their traditions and pay more attantions to some specific atributes of festivals, which can be symbolise health, wealth, success, or maybe femily hapiness, et cetera. Additionally, people would know better the histories of their countries and share those knowledge with younger generations. So, the youth could not only enjoy themselves during celebrations, but also become more intelligent about traditions in their homelands.
To sum it up, it is widely spread attitude on holiday organisation as to only having entertainment, dancing, and having wonderful moods during those days. However, if the history of festivals and ancient traditions is spread properly, people become more wisdom about the main reasons of those celebrations in their countries.
AI Essay: It is sometimes claimed that during festival periods, most people these days just want to relax and have fun, while the original meaning behind traditional or religious celebrations is often forgotten. The same can be said for cultural festivals like Lunar New Year, where fireworks and social activities may take center stage. However, I believe that there are still plenty of individuals and families who make an effort to remember and honor the original meanings during these occasions. Many parents teach their children about the stories and values behind festivals, such as forgiveness, gratitude, and togetherness. Schools and religious institutions also hold educational events to explain why these celebrations exist. In my view, while the desire for enjoyment has become stronger in our modern, fast-paced world, the essential meanings are not completely lost. Instead, they continue to be passed down in ways that suit today’s society, blending enjoyment with tradition. Therefore, it would be unfair to say most people have totally forgotten the real reasons behind these important days.

Question: Write about the following topic.Most people have forgotten the meaning behind traditional or religious festivals; during festival periods, people nowadays only want to enjoy themselves.To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Essay:
As the years go by, it can be clearly seen that our minds are starting to abandon the true meaning of a nation's religious and traditional festivals by replacing with something that is not even related to the legend behind the festival.
A great example of this is in India during the nations' biggest festival, Diwali. Diwali is celebrated across the nation in the month of October for it was when Lord Rama, the greatest hero of our holy Hindu scriptures returned victorious from his battle in Lanka by defeating the demon king, Ravana. Traditionally, there used to be mass 'pujas' (worship ceremonies) held in every nook and corner of the nation, you could literally find and join a puja ceremony anywhere you went in India.
Although they are still held, the new generation of Indian youth proudly known as 'Gen-z', is starting to abandon the true meaning of this festival by mending it in their own way. Instead of spending money to call over the poor and homeless to their homes to give them a meal (like what was traditionally done), they are using all that money on partying and gambling in the 'name of Lord Ram and religion'. I personally find this utterly disgusting and disrespectful. Although it is a much more eco-friendly method of celebrating than bursting crackers, I feel that it is like you are spitting in the face of Lord Rama.
The case of India and Diwali is just one of the many ways people are abandoning festive traditions to just enjoy themselves and not give back to the society (like the purpose is in at least all Hindu festivals).
At the end of the day, it depends of which country and it's festival. If you look like a nation like China, their grandest festival, the Chinese New Year as depicted in the picture given below, has still not lost it's authenticity. They still hae the same traditons intact as they were when it was first ever celebrated thousands of years ago.
But as a whole, traditional and religious festivals are losing their true meaning becasue of the intention of the youth to just enjoy themselves.

The spiritual aspect of the holiday is often overshadowed by consumerism and a strong desire to enjoy time off work or school. Similarly, in my own culture, the Lunar New Year was once a chance to reunite with family, honor ancestors, and pray for prosperity in the coming year. This trend, in my view, threatens the preservation of cultural heritage for future generations, and I believe there should be more emphasis on educating young people about the origins and values associated with traditional celebrations.

Question: Write about the following topic.Most people have forgotten the meaning behind traditional or religious festivals; during festival periods, people nowadays only want to enjoy themselves.To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
